reviewTitle: Worst TV I have ever purchased
reviewDescription: I have had this TV for less than a year and I HATE IT!  Every time someone wants to watch this TV, they have to start fooling around with it 20 minutes before the show they want to watch.  Every time we turn it on we get the death spiral for a few minutes before we get the notice that it can’t connect to the internet.  Then we have to try to uninstall the WiFi and reinstall it.  Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn’t.  If we are lucky enough that it does work after that, you can bet that at least 4 times between 8 and 11 pm, we will lose the signal and have to restart the TV and go through the install process again.I thought it might be my router, so I bought a new, more powerful router but that hasn’t helped at all.  The internet provider was out and couldn’t find any problem with their equipment either.If we do get this thing to work, it is difficult to navigate a streaming movie.  There are no fast forward or fast rewind buttons.  Instead you have to click on the circle around the ok button to go forward or back, but it is difficult (with my big thumbs) to do that without going to a menu below and eliminating all the rewinding already done.We have a small TV in the kitchen and an older TV in the master bedroom and we never have any issue with either of those.  They turn on immediately and have access to the internet.  No uninstalling and reinstalling every time.I will never waste my money on another Vizio product.

Over the years we have owned several Vizio smart TVs. Our experience has been that the larger, more expensive sets function beautifully. Although they do require a soundbar, they have a bright screen and function quite well for our needs.However, we have found that the smaller ones such as this are quite temperamental. Each one eventually has one problem after another and away they go to be recycled.I have this exact TV in my den. It's been fine, but glitches quite often. It's an ongoing joke in our house. The other set we had of this size died within a year.Forever an optimist, I decided to give Vizio one last shot with this set. Maybe we'd get lucky?Unfortunately, we have found ourselves in the same boat as prior.I purchased this TV for our workout room to exclusively play exercise DVD's. Plugged in the DVD player and the screen came right up, they play perfectly. We installed a soundbar and this also functions properly.The issue is connectivity. We are a large household with a myriad of devices, a strong internet connection and several boosters throughout the house. My password for my router works for all of our devices.Not so with this TV. After several attempts we finally gave up and have relegated this set to purely workout DVD's. Thats fine for our needs, but the set should connect regardless.At this point it's far past time for our family to move on to another brand.  We gave it our best shot.

reviewTitle: Not suitable for watching over the air (OTA) TV
reviewDescription: Pro: full HD (1080p) screen resolution.Cons: everything else! Especially OTA TV support and [the total lack of] Visio technical support.We bought this TV to use in the small bedroom on our RV where anything larger would be too big. We wanted a Smart TV for occasional streaming, but most importantly, we require solid support for OTA channels so we can watch local weather and other travel critical information.Well, while this TV technically supports an OTA antenna, Visio seems to have gone to great lengths to make sure it isn't suitable for OTA channel watching.The setup process was unnecessarily convoluted, and after finally getting thru it, the TV did an update that made OTA surfing, to say the least, difficult and frustrating.Normally, when using the up/down channel buttons, an OTA TV will show you what channel you are on. Nope, not on this set. That requires the annoying need to constantly reference the guide (loaded with disruptive advertising) to figure out where you are and find where you want to go.Visio has this "Watchfree" operating system that definitely does not favor OTA watching. If you don't care about OTA this may not be a problem for you, but overall I was completely underwhelmed and downright annoyed compared to other more mainstream TV operating systems.Another major flaw IMO, is this set only supports 2.4ghz Wi-Fi. Really?To top it off, a request to Visio service via Amazon went totally ignored. I for one will never consider purchasing another Visio product based on that fact alone.We ended up instead buying a Westinghouse 24" Roku TV set that is incredibly more user friendly and very nicely supports OTA. When surfing OTA channels, you get not only the channel numbers displayed, but signal strength, resolution, the time, and even basic programming info. And it supports BOTH 2.4ghz and 5ghz Wi-Fi. The Westinghouse Roku set also acts as a DVR (pause live TV) if you plug in a USB stick. Even better, the Westinghouse Roku set was 30% less expensive than the Visio! A much better choice IMO.On the downside, the Westinghouse Roku set was only 720p, but on this small size screen the picture clarity difference is not really noticeable to ordinary humans.

reviewTitle: Cheap TV that's fine when it works.
reviewDescription: Knew going into the purchase that at under $200 this was not going to be an amazing TV. Initial thought when I mounted it was that it felt cheap and plastic-ee - but also, who handles your TV, so not a big deal since it looks like a very regular TV with a normal if not slightly thick frame. But I just intended to use it in my office, so again, didn't need anything flashy. The biggest problem is the software and the connectivity.We get our content through wifi on apps like Hulu, Netflix, etc. To navigate to an app, you have to sit through and click through several options where Vizio tries to sell you stuff or get you to use their apps. I haven't had this issue on any of my other branded TVs - mostly Samsung. So it's annoying to turn the TV on and have to navigate for a comparatively lengthy amount of time just to get to the app that has the content you want to search through. The software is also slow but recently updated and is slightly faster. The second biggest issue is that almost 30% of the time, it doesn't want to connect to your wifi. Sometimes it can't find your network. Sometimes it just doesn't like your password. Sometimes it doesn't want to respond to inputs on the remote. If this were my main TV, I'd be unbelievably angry and I should probably rate this TV 1 star. But because it's an office TV, and don't rely on it, I'm not weighting the connectivity issues as severely.

reviewTitle: Wifi reception is abysmal, had to add a Roku to access streaming
reviewDescription: This is my 2nd Vizio 32" tv in service.  My first one had difficulty with Wi-Fi reception, it was just poor.  I thought due to distance and walls between the access point and the tv.  My second one has just as poor, if not worse, Wi-Fi reception that is so poor you cannot stream Netflix, Prime, PBS, etc..  I just purchased another Roku stick for this latest Vizio and Roku reception is "excellent" per the device.  So, if you purchase this TV, just know you'll either need a hardwire ethernet or you just bought a "screen" to which you'll add additional peripherals.  I own three Vizio TV's, in general they get the job done however the lesser cost of the tv has been offset by the cost of the peripherals - just know that.

This has to the the dumbest smart TV I have had.  The picture is nice but the Smart portion of the tv is horrible.  First off, the Vizio, is more concerned about getting your information than giving you a good experience.  At least with Roku Tv's they do that in the background and give you what you want not what they think you need.  The TV constantly disconnects from thew Wifi and you have to manage into the settings to get the wifi working again.  For the price and size of the tv I would expect it to have bluetooth headphone capability, it does not.  If you are going to use this as a smart TV then I would look elswhere

First for those with the same issue (the TV claims your password is incorrect),first go to all settings. Then to network,then to manual setup. Go into the DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) and turn it off and then on again. Make certain you are actually in the list that shows on off.  Turn the TV off. Then back on. Go to the list of available wifi sources and click on yours.It worked perfectly when I first set it up. But then it was updated. It was still working. I turned it off, and the next day the password is incorrect issue started. By research and experience I tracked down the problem. But it appears to be only a short term fix. The next day I had to do the same process again.  I went to the Vizio web site, but their chat system errored out on my firefox (latest build) browser.  This does not bode well. Lacking the connection issue I'd be quite happy with it.

reviewTitle: after just a month am having problems going to Amazon prime and Netflix
reviewDescription: I purchased this when i went to Arizona to stay for the winter and getting Internet from cox.  I didnt have a smart tv but had the Firestick from Amazon.  Since I also had a subscription to NetFlix i thought it would be  a good purchase.  I have had it less than the one month return allowed and now it is acting up.  i press Amazon prime and it come up as YouTube, I cant get the Amazon prime link no matter what i press.i like watching a series at a time over several nights.  after watching a season and 1/2 of the Jack Ryan series and not i cannot finish watching it,  i havent called it yet to Vizio to see if i can fix it, but really feel like i should not have to.  i have Vizio tvs at my home and havent had a problem

reviewTitle: Good picture but sound is poor, no Bluetooth for headphones or external speaker
reviewDescription: While this TV has a wonderful 1080p picture, the sound is far from good and poor, in fact.  It comes from the bottom of the TV and is very tinny sounding and seeming has LOTS of treble on it.  I have adjusted all sound adjustments with very little change:  going no treble, full bass and everything in between.  Since the speakers are under the TV itself, it does not project into the room at all.  I am not satisfied with this in the least.The poor sound is the same on all channels, movies and free TV.  As I like the picture and all other features, I will keep it and most likely add a sound bar.In addition to poor sound, there is no Bluetooth for headphones or external speaker.  Even my 10 year old Samsung has Bluetooth.  Yes you can add it, but that engenders other problems with connection and having to manually turn it on when you want to use it.  My old Samsung is totally automatic and connects when the headphones are activated.  Vizio should take note of this.  Bluetooth is not that expensive to have come with the TV.

The picture is decent enough and on occasion, the WiFi connection is a bit wonky (and it is not the fault of my internet).The remote weight is backward, awkward, an un-intuitive. The bulk of the weight should be at the bottom of the remote and not at the top. This allows for a more intuitive approach when picking up the remote in the dark where you expect the bottom weight of the remote to rest in your hand. Instead, the weighted top of the remote falls off your fingers (who's the brilliant architect who designed this?). Backlighting would help a lot.I will never purchase another Vizio simply because I cannot re-arrange the user interface. In its current form it is loud, abrasive, in-your-face advertisements. I wanted an interface more like Roku that shows my apps in big tiles with easy access. In Vizio, my apps appear as tiny little tiles to which I have to scroll.Using the apps feature allows me to remove unwanted apps, but I can do nothing about the tile size or placement, and I cannot rearrange or remove any other sections like Trending and Recommendations (which never align with my tastes)

The screws to support the TV stand don't even fit. Good luck if you want the stand, you better have some glue or a power drill to drill your own holes. I will be doing one of those two options because I want the stand to function properly.
This is my first smart TV. Not sure I appreciate the Vizeo-specific programming... but I really don't appreciate the picture freezing up at random.
Works well in my office to check the news now and then. Picture quality is good. Easy to set up.

reviewTitle: Very pleasing TV at a great price
reviewDescription: We bought this TV to replace one that expired after 4 years of ownership. We were delighted with the low cost.The only reason we did not give it 5 stars is that the pair of feet do not sit well on the table where we have the TV. There are two sets of legs on either end of the TV, and we cannot turn the set adequately to get an straight-on front view. Maybe the manufacturer would consider a fix for this.
Can't search internet.
The leg stands are not good.
First one didn't work. They replaced quickly. Second one works. Not the best TV I've owned, but pretty good and a great value for the price
Pretty decent TV
This TV is a good value, especially for a smaller space. Ours did come with a very small amount of discoloration in the upper corner, but it’s only noticeable when it’s off.
Esta bien para el precio

reviewTitle: Hate the remote and that Vizio 'controls' far too much! Want my Alexa Remote!
reviewDescription: The darn Vizio app talks - during setup that was fine and actually helpful.  But, with the tv it tells you everything! NOISY!
Good
The price and the value for the price.
It’s a small but nice tv.

I’m sure the tv will be fine but heads up the install process will take 30+ minutes on mediocre wifi I guess. So plug it in, put in some setup info and go cook dinner or clean your den or call a friend.
Too many buttons on the remote control
Image quality during prime viewing hours is poor
Nice picture nice size
working with optimum, you need to do many Manvers

reviewTitle: Almost there. These new smart tvs do not respect film modes.
reviewDescription: Design is excellent and function works. Quality wise I was expecting more from Vizio especially after owning another Vizio TV for 10 plus years. The film mode frame blends and does not look clear in terms of the gamma. The colors are hard to dial in.If you’re into sports or games this works out perfect. But it lacked just this portion. Hope Vizio upgrades this.
No BLUETOOTH - WOW!

Perfect fit for my rv kitchen tv replacement... not very loud so u need a sound bar. I typed in tv with built in DVD player and bought this one but that was Amazon's mess up and I didn't read it but all in all I replaced a 12 inch tv with a 24 inch and it's great for me

reviewTitle: Broken new in box, but Amazon made it right
reviewDescription: After talking with a service representative they did exchange the TV free of charge. I do appreciative that. I already have bought 2 before this and they are good tv's. Thanks for making it right amazon!

reviewTitle: I needed a smallish smart tv
reviewDescription: My homestead is powered by solar panels and batteries. I need to be somewhat frugal with my power use when the sun goes down, so the power drain was a huge factor in my selection of this pc. Roughly 56 watts for the Vizio, compared to the 15 year old Sharp Aquos that consumed upwards of 190 watts.EDIT:  The processor seems fairly slow, the screen is slow to post all the channels, and the remote can be clicked faster than the screen can keep up.  I have had to restart the tv in order to get the remote to work correctly.

reviewTitle: Heads up you’re getting what you paid for
reviewDescription: I had read the reviews and seen a lot of positive ones and a few negative.  I still went ahead and purchased the 40in. I like the screen size and brightness, clarity all the good stuff. Speakers are a little low but not a deal breaker.Only thing for me worth noting were the screws for the feet. They’re too large. They get down 3/4 and don’t move from there. Feet still not fastened. I put my own smaller(width) and shorter screws and feet and nice and secured. Nothing major for me. But could be for someone else.

reviewTitle: The menu portion takes a little to get used to
reviewDescription: The menu portion takes a little bit getting used to.

The tv part of setup was unbelievably easy.  Only took about 15 minutes.  However - getting the feet attached so that they wouldn't wobble took about 30 minutes!  That part should have been a cinch but the screws were very stubborn about going in straight.  I've done a lot of building in my life so it's not like I don't know how to use a screwdriver. :-)

Pros: the price and the fact it is 1080 when most TVs in this range are 720p is a plusVesa Mount compatible, so you can get a small Vesa stand and watch TV in the bedroom if you are running out of space. You can buy a stand like thisUniversal Swivel Tablehttps://www.amazon.com/gp/aw/d/B073F8D8ZZ?psc=1&ref=ppx_pop_mob_b_asin_titleCons: Not compatible with 5ghz newer modem WiFi standards it does connect to 2.4ghz band but make sure the modem supports the standard.Everything depends on an online update so this TV does require an active WiFi Internet connection to truly enjoy the TV.

reviewTitle: Does the job with one issue.
reviewDescription: A good mid-range TV.  Picture quality is good enough for the price. (wasn't expecting OLED quality at this price). Set up is easy and wifi connects right away. The one thing that irks me is the USB port is inoperable and is not identified in the settings.  HDMI ports work fine.

Overall I like the features of the TV and it's clarity. My only issues with it is every once in awhile when I turn it on an ad type thing for Vizio pops up and it takes a little longer to start up then I'd like
Great tv and great price but it’s advertised and yes, I made sure I bought the one that says 40 ins but it is actually 35.

reviewTitle: I like it but loads slow
reviewDescription: I like the tv, does great when Im playing my PS4. This tv loads streaming stuff slow
Like everything  about this TV  except  the sound is a bit underpowered.  Often  have watch the TV at 60 + .

reviewTitle: Price was great. Tv has beautiful picture. And the Vizio customer service was terrific.
reviewDescription: The  Vizio I had died after many years and this was its replacement. Delivery was fast, and so easy to set up.
It looks nice.hooked up to my internet and other devices nicely.only complaint is the speakers don’t sound that great,but ok
this was a birthday present  for my wife  easy set up
It was a good tv for the amount I paid for it. Definitely on the Lower end of tvs though. Would recommend for a bed room. Only thing I don’t like about it is that volume quality

Bought this to replace an earlier model Vizio whose audio had become unreliable. This TV is wall mounted and size was the number one criterion for the replacement. It fits the standard VESA mounting bracket. This TV is connected to our cable box (HDMI connection), so we don't use a lot of its built-in network capabilities (not its own remote).It did fix our issue with sound cutting out, but it has all the audio quality of a tin can on a string. Use of an inexpensive sound bar is highly recommended.

Overall was a good deal. No control buttons on main TV mean if your remote is out of batteries (or I suppose lost) you won't be able to use.  It can also be a little slow to turn on and respond at times, updating software or whatever.  Had read about this in other reviews and maybe has a slower processor?  Still overall pleased given price point.

I got this TV for my bedroom. Fits nice on top of my dresser. It’s like the fire stick without the stick. Apps are on it when I got and you can download ones you want. However the remote is not very good. Some apps I haven’t been able to sign into because of it.

I like the apps and free Vito tv. I did think it offered Roku but it does not which limits the streaming apps you can have. For one if you have Gaia you can’t watch it on this :(. Said chrome installed but no internet web access. Speakers are decent and better than Walmart brand. Still good and no need for speakers. I love it and perfect as a second monitor and bedroom/kitchen TV. I couldn’t air play my surface pro but that could be my tech skills with TV. All in all great bang for your buck
Great picture on it and easy step by step instructions.
Great TV .. only question is how do you use the mic? Maybe mine doesn't work... But I'm keeping it.

reviewTitle: Replaced a 10 year old Samsung  Nice TV but not much nicer than old one
reviewDescription: I would say the 10 year old Samsung actually may have a better color saturation even though it was only 720p.  This is 1080i but no matter what color pallet I use has more of a washed out look (I have found that the viewing height is pretty important on this TV though which is a bummer since we use in our kitchen so when I stand I'm looking down a little at it (washed out)  If I sit and am more straight across picture is better.Otherwise it is thicker than our old TV but more energy efficient.  Sound is good.  I would recommend this for the price (honestly not many options in the 24" space but I would temper your expectation as good not great.
This is a great TV for the money. Easy to hook up and easy to operate. Bought for a guest room.

Purchased for bedroom. I have an older, larger Vizio in my living room that I've been so happy with that when I decided I wanted a bedroom TV Vizio was my go to. I saw some reviews as to lag time & this model being slow. The only things that took forever were to updates upon setup. Haven't had long so I can't give 5 stars just yet but setup was super easy. Basically plug in & let update. Picture & sound quality seem good to me...I saw complaints about that too. It fits the small space where I wanted it perfectly too. Overall I recommend Vizio TVs because I think they're great quality.  I don't game so I can't speak to that aspect.

I sleep with the tv on and it seems to lose connection to my internet every night.  Sometimes I turn it on and have to reset my modem because it won't connect.  I have another (larger) Vizio in my living room and I don't have this issue so I'm pretty sure it's not the modem!  I'm a bit disappointed in this tv because of it's lack of connectivity.  It's always a hit or miss and the last thing I want before I go to sleep is aggravation of having to wait for connection or having to go reset my modem.  Not real happy with this tv.
Main tv in living area. Good sound and picture.

reviewTitle: Works as it should it should
reviewDescription: My daughters old TV finally died. We replaced it with this and she has had no issues with it.
This flat screen has Good quality sound, compared to most other flat screens.
VIZIO is a wonderful TV but it came with screen broken.

I gave this TV 3 stars because it cuts out a lot. I get "connection error" often. It only lasts about 10 seconds, but it happens a lot. The wifi is not the issue, my other TV works great. I'd upgrade to a newer model and not buy this one.

When this tv works it is good but it frequently can't connect to internet.  When it does this it usually takes about 15 restarts to get it to connect.  Very unreliable as a television, maybe it will make an ok monitor.Don't buy it

reviewTitle: TV only works if you accept Google’s terms
reviewDescription: You’ll need to accept google’s use and privacy terms (on top of vizio’s) for this to work properly. Can’t use apps or tv casting unless you accept everything! Can’t opt out (only skip), so you’ll be prompted to accept them repeatedly after an initial set up.
Tv doesn’t support my local cable company app
Tv has a weird color spot on the screen, perhaps a manufacture error. Tv didn’t stay connected to Wi-Fi
The remote control and tv does not respond quickly. It’s super slow. I wouldn’t buy this tv again.
TV works fine. Screws do not fit so cannot put the TV on the stands that were provided.
The sound on the tv sounds like 2006 quality. Seems faded and higher pitch then normal audio.
Had the tv for about 4 months, now I can’t access the apps for some reason.
I bought this tv because it was supposed to have a hard wired network connection. It does not. Other than that, the tv is fine. Its one of the few 32 inch tvs I found that had 1080p.

reviewTitle: it was Bluetooth compatible. I told them I need to return because it was not Bluetooth compatible
reviewDescription: I loved it, the volume wasn’t very loud but a beautiful picture if I had known about a Bluetooth adapter would fit and make it work. I wouldn’t have sent it back.

reviewTitle: Has trouble staying connected to wireless internet
reviewDescription: This TV has a great picture for the price but it has trouble staying connected to my wireless internet and does not work with AT&T internet air or Direct TV via internet. I returned it for an LG TV which was comparable in price and the LG TV is working great.

reviewTitle: Bluetooth and WiFi are not up to date. They're two years old.
reviewDescription: Sadly, Amazon doesn't give full descriptions of what this TV is built with.I went on online to download the specs for this TV. finding out it's two years out of date. Bluetooth on this is a 4.0 not 5.2. Wi-Fi is two years old. Speakers say 18 watts, but the manual specs say 7 watts for each speaker. I bought this for my mom because the remote was easy to work. I have a Samsung and I do love my big TV. The only thing I hate about it is their sucky remote. My mom does not do well with Internet. or Bluetooth. So I'm not that worried about it. But if I knew it had two-year-old components in a new TV, I would not have bought in it.
TV works fine. Speakers are cheap and sound bad but overall not bad. Beware the TV does not connect to 5G/5Ghz wifi and only can detect 2.4 Ghz.

reviewTitle: Bought for the built-in chromecast, but it crashes constantly
reviewDescription: Look elsewhere if your primary use is for casting youtube, etc to it.  Mine cannot go more then 45-60 mins without randomly stopping the cast for seemingly no reason. This doesn't happen on other chromecasts I have in my home. Good TV for the price otherwise.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviewDescription: The picture is just okay.  The sound is bad, I have to turn on the closed captioning to know what they are saying. It is slow to react when you want to choose an app to use or exit the app. It also freezes when a commercial is going to start. Which means that I have to exit out of the show, go back and when it starts playing, fast forward it 10 seconds. Then the commercial will start. Not real happy but like the title says, You get what you pay for. ☹️I was wrong, it does have HDMI and I’m so glad it does because I can use my Roku. I can plug earphones into the Roku remote and the sound is better than the sound coming out of the TV.

reviewTitle: Horrible picture that cannot be fixed
reviewDescription: If you like a washed out picture this s the TV for you.  No matter how many adjustments that are made the picture is awful.  In addition except for straight on viewing this TV is hard to see the picture.  Being returned.
have had the tv for one month and it now has a purple stripe down the middle of it.  we had thrown box away so didn’t know if we could return so it looks like get to live with the purplestripe.  😩

Color is very nice but the tv is small, not a problem but the picture is cropped bottom and top Sound pretty poor very disappointing. Problem you can not control settings like on other tv brand . Do not base your purchase on other comments as I did you will be disappointed. Going to Costco to get a real tv . Not worth the pain to send back I can use it on gest bedroom

reviewTitle: This is not a good option for older users!!
reviewDescription: This is not a TV by my definition. it has to be connected to your Wi-Fi and it basically runs on apps like a phone or computer. I had to get a cable box to use it with the remote and process that my 87yr old mother was accustomed to using.  Total hassle.

This TV is annoying at best. Constant connectivity issues, which is a common complaint if you look it up online. It will disconnect from the internet and we have to reset everything to get it fixed. That’s not a once and a while thing, it’s multiple times a week. This issue started about a week after we got it, so it’s not an aging problem.The picture quality and audio are fine. The input response time is pretty slow.I personally wouldn't recommend this TV, and I intend to replace it very soon.

From day one this thing would connect to Wi-fi fine and the next time it wouldn’t.  Couldn’t get it to work so finally set to factory reset.  After a couple of hours downloading/updating it worked again.  Until next time.  I kept meaning to send it back but now it’s not returnable.  It literally will not connect to the router.  The same router that works great for everything else.  Way too many hours invested trying to get a tv to work.

For a “Smart TV” a wireless only option is a terrible compromise.  For those of us without great WiFi or want to reduce the WiFi bandwidth having an available wired option is a must. I went to great lengths to make sure I had a good, solid Ethernet connection available wherever I needed to hang a TV and now I have to add one more wireless device to an already overcrowded wireless network.Picture is about as expected but nothing special.

reviewTitle: The TV constantly drops the WiFi
reviewDescription: Every 2 or 3 days the wifi can not be connected, so the support page suggests restarting my router, which most of the time fixes the connection issue, but what a pain.  My other TV's don't have this issue.  I would not buy this product again.

Had I known a current model TV did not include these ports I would not have purchased.Regarding performance, I have scanned for broadcast channels many times but never received all available channels even after trying 3 other antennas.The remote’s small keys and numbers were not easily seen or used.Regardless of the channel chosen, a clear distinct picture has not been displayed.I will request Return Authorization and buy another brand TV.

reviewTitle: Poor picture quality and worse sound.
reviewDescription: Set-up was laborious and non-intuitive.  Having multiple free channels is nice but switching to antenna channels is cumbersome.  My 15 yo Vizio has much better picture and sound quality and is easier to use in any mode.  Overall bad experience, would not recommend.

We bought this to replace a 2018 Sanyo dumb TV with a Roku stick in our camper. The sound compared to the old TV was MUCH worse, and the picture was no better, and on older pre-HD content it was worse.The app choices also weren't as good, so we'd have to keep the Roku stick to access some of the content we love.We returned it and bought a Roku TV.

Has problems with volume you literally most the time have to take it up to 100 just to hear it. I had a normal level and you know the commercials come on and then it’s beyond blasting. I’ve tried to adjust and follow instructions in addition to it’s constantly falling off the 2.4 Internet constantly having to redo your router, so it’s a bummer big bummer

reviewTitle: Works correctly about 30% of the time
reviewDescription: I’ve had multiple issues with this tv.Sometimes the apps don’t work. It’ll let you scroll thru stuff but you cannot open any apps so you have to unplug the tv and plug it back in about a minute later.Other times it decides to not connect to the wifi & it’s truly a struggle to get it to connect and work properly.

Update: there's also no Bluetooth capability , this tv is 35 inches not 39. Nothing. I will be returning for a full refund! It's a scam! Mmm I'm not really impressed.The remote is TERRIBLE AND LAGS UNCONTROLLABLY. There's also no mic on the remote, but claims to have voice control. HOW SWAY?! It's giving FALSE ADVERTISING.SOUND IS HORRENDOUS! No matter how you try to adjust it, more than likely will only sound good with a soundbar. I got this for my bedroom, & I'm really disgusted. Sounds like static noise behind what you're actually listening to.Color could be better, adjusting settings don't make a big difference.HD quality is actually really good. Does work with Alexa, and the app is okay.It's not giving 40' inches to me, looks small. I will measure it and update.I got it on prime day, even as it being "discounted" I feel like I wasted money. Mmmm don't know how I really feel just yet, but I know I'm not impressed.You're better off with a Samsung, and investing your money. I have a Samsung in my living room, that never misses. Sound on 20, but it relays like it's on 50. Picture quality & color immaculate! Depending on the model you get, the remote may or may not have a mic.SN: last picture is my mounted Samsung in my living room.

reviewTitle: D40f-09 does not connect to local channels.
reviewDescription: The WatchFree+ feature does not load local over-air channels. You will be stuck with a bunch of preloaded nature, cooking, and shopping channels instead. After the 40" set arrived, I spent 2 hours trying and over one hour talking to Vizio reps, who finally gave up and said there was nothing more that could be done. The Vizio D32f set that I bought a week or so earlier loaded some 50 of my local channels perfectly, but the 40" set would not load any, even though it has a stronger WiFi signal. I figured that set was just a lemon and sent it back to Amazon, and a replacement arrived the next day! Same problem as with the first set. If you want to watch, say, local news or sports, forget about it on the Vizio D40 TV.

reviewTitle: no sideloading, can't replace power cable.
reviewDescription: The tv came in one peace looks great setup took longer than it should but it's a smart tv and everything needs to update. picture quality is really good the back light bleed has its moments where its noticeable to being very impressive. sound as well isn't bad. it's a thin tv small speakers its more treb then bass but overall, for the price and size it was better than I thought.so why the two stars? not being able to replace the power cord in case of damage or wanting to make it longer is unacceptable its nothing more than ewaste. most if not all people will toss this tv out and not attempt to fix it. cats, dogs, vacuums. who knows maybe when moving it gets smashed or ripped on and now the tv is junk.second is only being allowed some apps.. no crunchyroll or internet browsing just casting from the phone. but I don't want to always be on my phone. it would be nice to be able to sideload or download what I want on a tv I bought and not have to use not only my phone and its battery life but the remote control. what's the point in a smart tv if I have to buy a device to make my smart tv smart? makes zero since to limit so many apps to this thing for no real reason besides money.if this is a tv you're buying for say games, movies or the listed supported apps like FUNimation, Netflix, Hulu, Disney + then this is a great option. but if you want Crunchyroll, moviebox pro, or anything else than looks for something different or spend some more cash on a firestick.

I just unpacked the TV. Setup was easy although it took about 15 minutes with all the updating. I was able to mirror my iPhone 14 but I am unable to Airplay to the TV like I do to my other Apple TV devices. The TV says it’s connected to my device but neither sound nor picture show. Screen mirror is rocky at best and that’s with me getting 50/20 mbs up/down on my iPhone right next to the TV.Since the whole purpose of the TV is to watch youtubeTV and watch movies from my phone I can’t really give more than 2 stars.I will search for more help online and leave further feedback when I get answers.

This television is really meant to be a security monitor, for the picture isn't bad, but everything else is garbage.Underpowered, so navigation is slow and clumsy, no Bluetooth, so listening through the terrible speaker is the only option, and why it's called a smart tv I do not know, it doesn't even have the ability to download additional apps.The upside it's affordable, but you get what you pay for.

reviewTitle: This little tv is mediocre, at best.
reviewDescription: So listen, I had an idea of what I was kind of getting into with this TV after reading mixed reviews. I didn’t really need a high quality television that was super large, so I settled on this one. Ha ha… Thank God I got it on sale.1. It’s very small and very frail2. Believe the reviews that say that it is slow and or lags very hard. It also tends to just freeze.3. At one point, after having the tv for almost 2 months, the bottom half of the remote, from the “Home Screen” button down, stopped working.  It took over 20 minutes and a few taps on the side of my couch (literally) to get the remote to pair back to the tv.Literally, at this point, it’s doing the bare minimum job of what I need it to do, I got it for half its worth on sale so I’m just rolling with the punches ha ha.  But if you’re looking for a good quality television, even for a smaller size, I would pass on this one.Update: just today as I write this review the remote once again has stopped working from the home button down so I’m not able to turn the volume up or down Baha! I mean first world problems but still…this tv would be worth about $50 at best!

reviewTitle: Los que parecia bueno no sirvió
reviewDescription: Recibi el TV, las principales funcionalidades no sirven fuera de USA, sin embargo lo programé con Netflix, Amazon Prime, y canales locales, al tercer día dejo de funcionar, se enciende pero queda en pantalla blanca, al ser una marca que no esta representada en el Pais de instalación, no hay un centro de servicio que lo pudiera revisar. Lastima parecía un excelente producto, pero fallo.

The tv is fine.  I needed a small tv to fit into a design scheme and this was it.  I gave this 2 stars because they either gave me the wrong legs, or there is a problem with the fit where the legs go.  I will be mounting the tv so I only have to deal with this issue temporarily.  In the meantime, I can't use the tv at all because it tips over and I don't want to break it.  I wouldn't of even bothered with the review, however, It's been one quality control issue after another with Amazon.

Althought this tv has a great picture it does not have a big supply of apps for instance if you have direct tv or Spectrum you can not download their apps with out buying some other device , it also does not have bluetooth so you can not connect a bluetooth speaker thru wifi. Needless to say i am disappointed in this purchase

So overall the set up of the TV as in programming etc. that was super easy. There’s like a QR code for all of the apps just about so you don’t have to input from your phone which made it again super convenient BUT the legs attaching them—- the screws were complete. Crap. no seriously the screws are so crappy and the wrong size and so it would not screw all the way in where it was flush and so it’s a little wiggly. If I wasn’t so lazy I would send it back.
A bit outdated but it’s still a good flat screen for the money. The phone jack is the old 3.5mm round jack, so a bit outdated. No bluetooth.
I Was Anxious At First Due to The New Fixtures.Now I Am Very Comfortable Using It And EnjoyingMy New Smart TV Set

reviewTitle: Only has HDMI (ARC) external speaker output. There are no RCA type output jacks.
reviewDescription: Great picture and decent sound. I would have given 5 stars had it not been absent the RCA style speaker output jacks. For the money it's a decent purchase.

reviewTitle: I wish the remote lit up
reviewDescription: This is just an extra TV we have in our family room, nice size, and a bit of a pain to set up. The remote does not light but which is the downside to this Picture quality is good

I love Vizio but every TV I've had fell once and the screen completely shattered. It just fell slightly. Its not durable. It also turns on when my roommate uses her remote fire stick, so kinda of an inconvenience. But they replace my TV so it all works out.

I love this TV. Really easy setup. My only issues is the feet stand. Getting the screws in was a pain. Be ready with an electric screwdriver or a lot of hand and wrist strength. I love being able to use the YouTube app and sign into my account with ease.I highly recommend this!
Great cheap TV for someone who does basic viewing.Super slow/laggy UIOnly use it with something plugged in to hdmi

I didn't notice that this TV doesn't come with Bluetooth. Otherwise I would have given it 5 stars.Update: I am sending this TV back in exchange for a TCL 43". I started having a lot of problems and since I'm still in the return period I am avoiding future issues that will prevent me from returning it. The HDMI input would freeze and prevent me from switching to my Xbox from Smartcast. The TV also would not power up without unplugging it and plugging it back in. The apps lag and Chromecast worked 50% of the time. I hope the TCL performs a whole lot better.

The picture is nice which is unfortunate because you cannot ignore the audio. It sounds like the speakers were already broken/water damaged when the TVs are sold new. I wish it was something you can just ignore but its not. It’s too low and it’s blown out. I had to return it not even a week after buying it.Im trying out the d-series and honestly, Vizio is just a crap company and a bunch of scamming liars. The d-series has good audio and picture, but now it keeps saying that it cant connect to my internet every time i turn the thing on. There is absolutely nothing wrong with my modem and this has never been a problem with any of my devices. Try a different company altogether. Vizio is pathetic and I hope their business drowns.

The Vizio connected wirelessly to my internet. And it was easy to set up although it did take awhile to install updates. It's not a high-end tv so the picture quality isn't as crispy as others. However the price makes it just fine for me. The sound is actually quite good. I used the legs instead of wall mounting. The legs seem a bit flimsy but I don't plan on moving it I may not but another one but as a traveling healthcare worker it's light enough to travel with. Especially when some locations have no television.The biggest flaw is there is not an option to install more apps. However it comes with a ton installed and it has everyone I want. If you have a rare app this may not be for you.

reviewTitle: Very Poor Sound, No 5G connectivity, Set-up Hassle, only 2 HDMI ports, picture good for price
reviewDescription: My TV took a very long time to get set up downloading and trying get set for operation.  It never was successful in getting my account set up even though I tried multiple times via the computer and mobil phone & app.  Guess it's not that important but I'm not sure since it was not successful.I hate the internal speakers they are terrible and I'm just using the TV in my bedroom.  Kind of hate using this TV because if I turn it on I have to listen to it's internal speakers and I often can't understand what words are being said.  I used audio settings to try to get the loudest/best sound I could based on others recommendations and my experimenting still audio is no good.  I had to order a sound bar which cost close to the price of the TV but now I have to wait for it to arrive and hope that works out.There is no Spectrum App in the installed apps and I could not download it into the Vizio control center, so I have to use a current Apple TV box.  Since you have to use a Roku, Apple TV, etc to add apps you have to use one HDMI port for that and the other for sound then you're out of HDMI ports.  The Apple TV with the Apple/Spectrum remote that Spectrum sent me works much better than the Vizio control center of apps and having to use the Vizio remote the Apple/Spectrum remote is far superior and it is lighted.  The DVR through the Apple TV does buffer, pause and shows freeze, I think it might be because this Vizio TV does not support 5G connectivity, kind of a turn off for a new TV purchased in 2023.The TV seems to turn on all by itself which is annoying and distracts me when I'm trying to work or concentrate on something important.There is an annoying light that lights up real bright at times and then blinks for several minutes.  When it's pitch dark in my bedroom at night and these lights come on it is not good, it is also distracting and annoying.  When I turn off all my bedroom lights for bed it's suppose to be a peaceful time.The picture quality seems pretty good but not as good as my 2008 Samsung 32" 1080p TV which recently started malfunctioning.  But the sound of the Samsung was way, way better than this Vizio.  Others have said that the sound is so bad because of the very thin screen.  I'd rather have a TV with decent sound than have a TV with a thin screen.  Wish I didn't have to order the sound bar to hear the dialog in my shows I watch.

reviewTitle: OK, But Poor Sound and Xfinity Issues
reviewDescription: This TV is just OK.  It serves its purpose and was a decent price, but there are some things people should be aware of if this TV is on their shortlist.  First, the sound is not great on this TV.  It's tinny and even with adjustments it's OK at best.  I bought an external sound bar that helps (thankfully).  Also, if you are an Xfinity customer, you cannot use the Xfinity app directly.  :O  You have to use an external streaming device such as a FireStick or Roku Stick and download the Xfinity app via the other device and use it from there (so stupid!).  Oh, and if you go the FireStick route, you need to have a FireStick running Fire OS 6 or higher, or it still won't work (learned that the hard way).  So be prepared to spend $160 on the TV itself... but possibly more if you like decent sound and are an Xfinity customer with an older FireStick.

reviewTitle: An exceptional value; but the stand fit poorly and program data is difficult to view!
reviewDescription: The picture and sound of this set are easy and intuitive to personalize -- and the on-air tuner pulls in most of the broadcast channels in my area, and the image is clear and sharp. The dimensions of this unit are also just about perfect for use in a kitchen or small bedroom.Switching channels is also fast, and most parts of the menu system are intuitive and easy to negotiate.(However .... )My vision is better than 20/20 in both eyes -- but even two meters from this set, the numbers and letters on the screen are impossibly small to read as you enter channel data using the remote.  Rectifying this problem was "the opposite of intuitive," and required my utilizing zoom/adaptive features that allow you to only view the center (not the corners) of the broadcast image.And, the (plastic, weak) stand components did not fit correctly -- screws to secure them had to be forced into the edge of the screen: a scary moment, during which I worried that I might crack one of the plastic parts.Generally happy with the value; but not with the on-screen data presentation or the fit and finish.

reviewTitle: I wouldn't buy again, but it's not terrible.
reviewDescription: So, I felt like I struck a good deal when buying this TV. And I sort of did.It displays pretty clearly, volume is crisp and clear. It easily runs the PS5.There's just a few downsides.1. It will randomly freeze up and/or turn off.2. After a few months of use there is sometimes a random line of black across the screen. I haven't left it on paused or anything, and the blocks of black come and go. No matter what I do, I cannot seem to get amazon to allow me to upload images of this. Just know you may have random areas where the display is darker or where it is blacked out.3. Updates are annoying, but don't take terribly long.Though I am glad I purchased this TV because it is an okay purchase, I plan on investing in a better one for my living room and moving this one to my bedroom. I wouldn't purchase this again due to the darkened spots that appear every so often, and the fact that it sometimes just shuts off.If you are on the lower side of income and are looking for something decent, I'd recommend this for you, but I definitely want something more reliable at some point.

Well most of the tv's in my home are Vizio's so when I saw a sale I thought let me get one in each room. Got them up and running and it's been an interesting set of events the tv's work they only can get the apps that are there so that's not cool I have to watch my tv in livingroom to watch my xfinity app. They take a few to respond to a request from remote control. These are good for a guest room that is not used much or kids room. I will be looking for new TV for my bedroom.

I was excited to put this Vizio TV in our kitchen, and the 32 inch size was perfect. My advice is if you intend to use this TV with only a wifi connection, don't do it.We just upgraded to fiber optic cable, and every other device in our home is working great. This TV had a LOT of difficulty connecting to our network, even though our router is split for 5ghz and 2.4ghz connectivity. I tried connecting multiple times to both, and after calling our internet provider to make sure everything was stable on our end, the TV finally made a connection.Almost every time we turned on the TV, it would have to buffer to make a connection. The picture quality was good, and the remote works well, but I couldn't deal with the slow wifi connectivity.If you're plugging a coaxial cable directly into this TV, or using it with a digital antenna, it should work fine. Just don't depend on its wifi capability.Grateful to Amazon for easy returns. Went with a Samsung TV instead, which connected to our wifi flawlessly and has been working great.

I recently mounted a VIZIO 32-inch D-Series Full HD 1080p Smart TV in my kitchen, drawn by its features like Apple AirPlay, Chromecast Built-in, and the promise of a crisp picture. True to its claims, the TV delivers nicely on picture quality, making my cooking shows and morning news much more enjoyable with clear, vibrant visuals.However, calling it a "Smart TV" feels a bit misleading due to its restricted app ecosystem. The main downside is the limited selection of apps available. Unlike other smart TVs that offer a wide range of applications, this VIZIO model limits you to a handful of pre-approved apps, which feels like a way to nudge you towards their subscription services. This was a bit of a letdown for me, as I expected the flexibility to download and use any app I wanted.I found myself purchasing an Apple TV to bypass this limitation and access the apps I needed. While I appreciate the TV's quality and performance, be prepared to invest in additional hardware if you're looking for a truly smart experience with unrestricted app access.

the screws that you use to attach the legs to the tv were both too long and too wide. Like the ones that came in the box specifically for that. I stripped the holes they go in trying to fit them.  I had to spend 35$ on a separate tv mount and dry wall anchors in order to watch the tv safely. So if you buy this tv, you’ll need to add a wall Mount to the cart too if you want to watch tv the same day it’s delivered.

reviewTitle: This tv has a great picture
reviewDescription: I was surprised this cheap little smart tv packs a punch! If you see this just get it. It has all the plug-in ports you need for gaming and video watching. It’s a smart tv so you can watch your apps right from the tv. It also has airplay so you can cast movies to the tv. It has a headphone jack so at night I can put my headphones on and not wake anyone. It has a crystal clear picture as well. It has many color/brightness adjustments as well. I absolutely love this tv and am surprised at the performance. You can download the Vizio app and operate this tv from your phone. It looks just like a remote, plus the vizio app has tons of great movies etc. I just love it! Better than Roku in my opinion!UPDATE: The picture is very pixelated on dark scenes but so crisp and clear on bright scenes. I’m honestly thinking of returning this. Dark scenes look so blotchy and awful. Dropped my rating down to 3 stars due to the pixelated mess!!!

reviewTitle: Alright for the price, but does crazy stuff on its own
reviewDescription: This TV isn't bad as far as picture or volume quality, for a bedroom, as far as I can tell, at least. I did originally rate it at 5 stars, because when it first arrived we of course took it out of the box and plugged it in and everything to make sure everything on it worked, which it did, so it went back in the box for a little while until we got moved into our new place, which is why we bought it to begin with, but after setting it up in the new place finally, now it keeps randomly turning itself on, somehow. At first we thought maybe one of the cats stepped on the remote that was on the bedside stand or something like that, so we finally decided to put the remote in our dresser drawer to make sure it didn't get "accidently" turned on again, but it is still randomly turning on, which we realized is the actual TV itself turning itself on, somehow, and nothing to do with the cats or anything else, since the remote is in the dresser drawer now, and the dresser/chest it's sitting on is to tall for the cats to jump on and get anywhere near the TV, so at least once a day we end up having to shut the TV off, after it turning itself on. I'm not sure what could cause such a crazy issue with it, but just make sure to keep an eye on it and don't think you're crazy if it happens to you, because you most definitely are not! I wish we would've tested it out a little better during the 30 day return window, even though we weren't going to be using it during that time period, I just like to plan ahead, so I probably bought it much sooner than I should have, but anyway, the moral of the story is to just make sure to properly test it over a few days time period, and don't make the same mistake we did. Other than it doing that crazy stuff, the TV itself seems nice (would definitely be a lot nicer if it didn't randomly turn on by itself, but what can you do, lol). That's the only reason I changed my rating to 3 stars now, from 5 stars previously, though. Good luck! 🌝

Purschased for my wife's office to just watch cable TV.  Got it hooked up and working.  Next day, turn on TV and it is going through software update.  Never ended.  Finally unplugged the tv and restarted it.  Got it working again and decided to disconnect the internet so it won't do more software updates.  That lasted a day and wouldn't work.  Called Vizo tech support and we went into the settings to set it to always go back to the last setting it was on just before shutting off the TV.  Then in the middle of the night the TV comes on with an error code it is not connected to the internet. So I had to go into settings and set it up to go back to the HDMI 1 to get to cable TV.  Conclusions:1. The sofware on this little 24" TV is more complicated than need be for a little TV.2. It will not display the HDMI connection you are using so switching it back to the settings is not possible.  Very aggravating.3.  If I don't want the TV connected to the internet, then Vizo get over it and let it be!!!This TV offers lots of options.  Probably more than needed for this size ofTV.  I have a Sony 77" TV that doesn't offer these many options.  I can accept all the software options if it would leave me alone when I only want the watch cable TV and NOT stream!!  Vizo fix your complicated software scheme on this TV and you'd have a very nice product.
BEWARE this TV and apparently all newer Vizio Smart TV's do not have the SPOTIFY app and there is no way to add it.

reviewTitle: The quality of this model is not so good.
reviewDescription: I purchased this TV about 4 months ago, it was all fine but a couple days ago, it couldn’t connect to WiFi anymore. I tried several methods to solve it, but still failed to connect the WiFi. This model seems not good.

Will not hold a WiFi connection.  Plug in a FireStick and it works perfectly.  Other issue is an occasional buzz in the sound.  How to return?  Box went to recycling several days ago.  We have 3 other Visio tvs, never had a problem.  Because I cannot connect to the WiFi from the main Visio Home I also cannot change or adjust some settings.

reviewTitle: Some apps not allowed/ discoloration in pixels already
reviewDescription: Won’t allow local cable apps and there is already discoloration in the pixels on one corner after only 2 months of use.
The box looks like it had been around the world. The screen had smudges and finger prints. Missing some of the hardware.

reviewTitle: I had owned better Vizio products
reviewDescription: This TV is not like other Vizo tv's I have owned. It was difficult to set up and quality is basic.

reviewTitle: Vizio tried too hard on this one
reviewDescription: Hmm, it’s been a few years since I bought a new TV and, at least this one, has way too many entertainment options for its own good. With all the streaming and free apps out there, Vizio, for reasons I suspect are related to partnerships with apps like Pluto TV and Tubi, has them all on a chip in this TV. Which, slows down its performance and makes it more complicated than need be. And if you don’t have wi-fi then you can’t use the apps anyway! Wish I never bought this thing, but, I’m stuck with it so maybe after reading this you won’t be.

reviewTitle: it works when it wants to.
reviewDescription: Lags, freezes, turns off skips, this tv has a mind of its own but it gets the job done.

Components in the tv cause it to drop wifi connection intermittently and its a giant pain. Signal remains Excellent as the router is on the other side of the wall, so it’s not the wifi. Picture is awesome. Sound is great. Apps work as they should, if the tv can stay connected to the wifi long enough. Plan on using a wired connection or plan to call support and be stuck for 2 days waiting for a service request. If Vizio Support can help me out this would be a 4-star tv for the price and quality

I don't know why I totally spaced out on how small a 40" tv would be, but this was too small for our needs and the image quality was really low res. I suppose for the price point, if you're not too concerned with image quality and actually looking for a 40" tv (not 55 or 60") this is okay, but I had higher expectations so it was returned.
Only can find smart TVs now, need two remotes to work tv and my tea network!  Volume on Vizio ,no controls on set. Need to reboot quite often. Hard to figure how to use
Llegó bien, se ve bonita y el sonido está bien. Lo único es que si vives fuera de EE.UU el sistema de Vizio no te funciona, por lo que compré un Chromecast para usarlo con Google tv.
No ethernet port as advertised and vizio support don't know that.
Remote is less functional than I am use to (ROKU channel rotation) ,but all-and-all it is a good unit.
It looks great but its slow when loading, I haven't been able to get on Netflix yet because it won't load.

Got this to upgrade from my 32 inch Vizio that is now in my bedroom.  Set up was easy. Nice picture. Volume seems less than the old 32.  Also the stand is nowhere near as stable as the old 32 inch as well.  Don't know why they changed that.  Have not tried the apps yet but the updates all went through smoothly so I assume there will be no issues.  All in all it suits my needs.  The old 32 inch has served me well, I hope this one does the same.

I bought this for my wife to use in her study as a replacement for an old 20 inch. The High Def picture was a big upgrade as well as a slightly larger screen. Also, it was very light weight and I was able to turn it upside down on my thighs to screw in the support feet. The whole thing weighs just a little over 6 pounds. On the negative side, Vizio tries to get you to use all kinds of video services so I had to decline a lot. All I wanted was to link up with our cable provider which was also easy to do. The instructions were not top notch but I watched a couple of you tube videos which made the set up quick and easy. Recommend the 24 inch a good second TV.

reviewTitle: Very good quality TV with a nice price.
reviewDescription: This TV has a very good picture quality and is packed with a lot of nice features. The reason for 4 stars is because during use of remote control there’s a slight delay in the signal transmission of the buttons pressed. So it takes a special talent to operate it.  However, I would like to offer some advice:  if you are purchasing a TV for an elderly person in the beginning stages of dementia, don’t purchase a different brand than what the elderly person has previously used because they will find it very challenging.  I purchased this TV for my elderly mom and the best she can do is turn it on/off, I have search and select the channels for her.  Today’s TVs are very sophisticated to operate by seniors.
One caveat is that it can't show dark scenes very well. Otherwise, the picture is crisp and true to life at a bargain price.
So far, so good, I have had it almost 2 weeks awesome picture, easy to set up. I like it, I pray it stays good.
So far so good, no complaints and it works great to date!

reviewTitle: Best product from very well-known Company
reviewDescription: Excellent choice and a great valued product from the great Amazon listings.

Keep up the amazing job you do. I love the product and the shipping was awesome and on point. The delivery driver was an awesome person and was very respectful and professional and very polite. I say all involed need a raise or treated better.
Bought this to put in my workshop.  Could not believe the price and features.  A total solution.
It’s clear and has all my apps

reviewTitle: Not hard to set up n easy to move around
reviewDescription: My samsung of 15 years quit n wanted new ,small,easy to set up love this product.
The TV worked perfect. 2 days later I got a error message saying I didn't have the internet.

reviewTitle: Came on time, in good condition for a Christmas gift for my sons bedroom.
reviewDescription: Happy with our purchase. Came in time, in great condition and works great. Bought for my sons Christmas gift for his bedroom for when he comes home from college and he loves it. The remote is super easy too, I hate a remote with too many buttons! It comes with legs which you don't see in the pic because our cat pushed the TV off the nightstand so we have to reapply them. Happy with the purchase and the vendor. Hope the pics help!
Price right. Fast delivery.
Immediately went into an update after turning on. Took almost an hour. Then it did it again. Now it’s stuck updating the Apps. Still updating…..
Muy bueno excelente

reviewTitle: Smartcast isn't available in the Caribbean so can't fully enjoy the tv
reviewDescription: Not a bad TV jus ashame it smart hub can't work in the Caribbean making it useless if u don't have firestick or cable

This TV is a bargain but remember you get what you pay for. It constantly freezes up. I have to do a restart almost everyday because it will show a message that says the channel is not available. When you change the channel it doesn't show what channel you are on. You can't block channels that you don't want to see. I will never buy another VIZIO.

I am about a week out of the return window so returning isn’t an option. In this short period of time, so many connection issues with this tv. Every other tv in the house will work except this one. Can’t find the network. It will connect and open streaming apps then not play any of the shows. It’s a crap shoot when it gets turned on: will it play or won’t it. Such a hassle. Pick something else.

This was rebuilt or something. My son has a hard time using it because it’s extremely slow to react when you press any button. Press volume down and it will go down after a couple seconds, keep pressing volume down and it remembers , then your watching the volume go down for however long it takes to get to zero. I’m very upset that I bought this.

reviewTitle: The sound has to be turned to about 50 to even hear it
reviewDescription: Color isn't that good

Worked good for a couple of months. One day I went to turn it on and everything was in Spanish. I watched YouTube to try to get through it. It’s confusing. Now it doesn’t want to operate at all still in Spanish. Tried to get help through Visio And all that does is revert you to YouTube channels confusing

reviewTitle: tv pictue develop strips in the screen
reviewDescription: poor quality

reviewTitle: TV was sold used like new, but, shipped like an used  item out of original box
reviewDescription: USPS dropped of the item and it seemed very loose in the box. I opened the box to find just a TV wrapped in plastic with foam ends , not in original Vizio box just loose in an oversized brown box with no extra protection to take up the extra space or protect the screen. The remote and stand legs were loose in box, no paperwork or even plastic wrap to protect the screen. I unpacked the TV and immediately got hit with the smell of overheated or burnt electronic component smells.TV powered up and went thru several cycles of screen updates, finally was able to see TV function and picture quality.Picture quality was pretty good, some text / titles seemed blurry and the sound at 40% was decent but had to be that loud.We are very unhappy with this purchase and are in the return process.
My kids love it
Todo esta bien

I love them streaming apps. So easy to set this tv up for streaming or watching regular channels on this TV. The picture somes in crisp and clear. For the price this tv is a steal. Get yourself a Vizio TV. I bought this 40 inch for my living room but I also go a 40 inch foe my bedroom that is 2 years old but still going strong .
Just what I needed for my camper. Great picture with a lot of functions.
Great TV for a good price!!
Connects to a smartphone by an app, great picture, nice medium sized screen
Muy bueno ahora ya tengo paraf ver películas con mi niña 🥰
Great deal and very satisfied
Wonderful tv for the money!!!

reviewTitle: Very happy with it.  Well priced, excellent picture quality.
reviewDescription: Very happy with it.  Well priced, excellent picture quality.  I pair it with Apple TV with very good results.

Overall a pretty okay TV at the price, not a horrible picture and the bezel isn't too big. The part that bugs me is the mess of aps that the tv has on it. There are so many and the reaction time of the TV is pretty bad. Maybe if there was less ads and clutter on the home screen it would help. Again it is a cheaper pick and not bad at the price range but offload some of the apps if you want it to run decently at all. Also it is almost impossible to stream my phone to the TV without it glitching and trying the same with Youtube is a pile of hot garbage. My advice would be to spend a little more $ and get a TV that can handle the 30 app minimum most of these Tv's nowadays come with.

Bought this to replace a tv that went bad in our kitchen. Hooked it up today and watching NFLplayoff games. I use Chromecast to stream and the built in Chromecast in this TV worked perfectly and was more than easy to set up. In fact as soon as I went through the initial set up process the TV already knes I had chromecast and the TV responded as soon as I used my phone to start streaming. I was a little concerned about sound quality from other reviews but in my set up its really very good. Remote is fairly simple and intuitive. Its a very lightweight TV and worked really well with the TV wall mount I also bought. Only negative is I wish the power cord had been a little longer. But overall very happy!Update - after using it for a few weeks I’ve noticed the built in Chromecast device is not the same as a “regular” chrome cast. On many channels it does not download video and audio at the same rate, so the video lags noticeably behind the audio, and it gets worse the longer you watch. I’m talking several seconds after watching 2 minutes. I plugged in my separate Chromecast  into one of the hdmi ports and now the problem is gone. Still like the tv but it’s disappointing I need to have another device plugged in to make it work properly. I’m going to contact the manufacturer to see if this is normal or the set is defective.

Let me begin by saying that I worked as a Home and Business A/V Professional for the last 17 years. Highly adept with technology and computer programming. Having said that, this particular “smart TV,” is not so smart, nor intuitive. I’m accustomed to setting up a vast multitude of tv and stereo equipment. This is just a tv. You would imagine you can just screw in the coax cable and begin watching your provider’s channels. In this case, no. It defaults to Visio TV, online. I could stream all my services fine, but I jumped through a vast multitude of hoops, before I could watch my Spectrum channels. Not happy. Then after a week of watching these channels, we lost power and I had to go through the entire process again… most frustrating.
Light quick simple tv if your WiFi is strong… only down side is the sound .. it sound like cheap headphones

I wanted a small smart TV for my bedroom and it was just right. The good ... It has good features and streaming options. The bad ... the functionality is not user friendly. 1. It takes a long time to power on. So long, over 30 seconds, till I question if the on registered so I click on again only to realize that I just turned it off! 2. Finding PBS app once installed was like finding lost keys ... where is it? 3. Volume is so low! I don't really like it to loud, but except commercials and talk/game shows I need to turn up to over 50% of max to get a comfortable setting. 4. Changing channels is a manual pop up menu and another 30 second pause! 5. Impossible to read small screen fonts and there is no way to adjust font size. Enough said. Would I buy again...NO!
This TV does NOT hook up to a sound bar. It has no hdmi connection available
Can’t add new apps on this smart tv. I would not have purchased had I been aware of that.

It was delivered August 30 and by September 29 it started acting up. Twice today and I turned it off and it came back on by itself a number of times! reviewTitle: Make sure to avoid the confusion
reviewDescription: The term 1080p refer to the resolution transmission standard of TVs. not the visual resolution.  It means the device is capable of receiving signals of 1080 lines of picture in a "progressive scan" mode (rather than "interlaced" mode). But it does not guarantee that it can display it as 1920 dots per line and 1080 lines on the screen, which is the display resolution. That means that the display will be not as sharp as one specified as 1920x1080 display. This TV says "Full HD 1080p" but does not give the screen resolution, a yellow flag.Further, the display technology can be LCD (Liquid Chrystal Display) or LED (Light Emitting Diode). There are advantages and disadvantages to either, beyond the scope of this review.  This device advertises as LED but then proceeds to state that it is backlit by LED (a feature of LCD displays), raising questions as to which it really is.  Again, a yellow flag.I personally got burnt enough to be skeptical of fuzzy advertising, you make your own judgement.

reviewTitle: Decent budget TV, but nowhere near great
reviewDescription: I purchased this TV open box. Saved a little off of the original price. I got the 40" which is perfect for my office. Upon unboxing, I was a bit disappointed that there wasn't an Ethernet port on the TV. The TV relies on good WiFi connection, so if the room you intend to put this TV in has poor signal, choose a different TV. Setup was easy, standard for a TV. The TV is incredibly light, even with its size I can hold it with one hand. Should be very easy to mount. I find that there are times when I turn the TV on, Vizio's media streaming center (main menu) does not want to load up. I don't know if its an issue with the TV or the internet signal, but I can press a media button like Netflix, then back out of Netflix, and then the main streaming center comes up.The sound is not so good. Sounds like cheap speakers, but expected for a budget unit. Picture quality isn't terrible, but when watching football, the image gets a little blurry during high speed camera movements.This unit would be perfect for the user who wants to have something to watch while working, or for background noise. I wouldn't put this up in a living room for routine use unless you had no other options.

reviewTitle: Inputs not at pictured... but overall pretty good for the size
reviewDescription: I bought this 24-inch TV for my 17-foot travel trailer.  I installed it and used it for two weeks.My #1 criticism is that the photo here on Amazon shows that the input jacks are on the side of the TV.  I was counting on that when I chose to order this particular TV.  They are not on the side as shown.  They are on the back.  I purchased a super flush wall mount and the jack locations created an issue for me.  I had to buy a 90-degree antenna jack adapter, a 90-degree HDMI adapter, and a two-way HDMI switch to make this work.  One of the HDMI ports was not available to me because my mounting plate covered it.  This was not supposed to be the case because the ports shown here on Amazon are on the side, not the back.Next up is the built-in Chromecast.  Turns out this feature only works if the TV is connected to the Internet.  Since my install is in my travel trailer, this is not the case.  Thus, Chromecast won't work for me at all.  I had to buy an HDMI to mini-USB cable to hardwire my phone to the TV in order to show downloaded Netflix content.All these adapters etc cost me a lot more $$ and still left me lacking in functionality that I thought I would have.With the above drawbacks noted, the TV otherwise worked well in my trailer.

The register is too low for me to hear clearly. Others had same problem on this particular problem but still continue to sell this defective model. I have an LG in the living room and it is great but it was a gift.

It does not come with a voice remote. It’s very difficult to search for APPS. It did not come with some of the free APPs. It was next to impossible to load new Apps on to the TV. The picture is clear. The sound is excellent.

reviewTitle: Just Don't. If you do, I warned you, and it's your own fault.
reviewDescription: This was by far the worst television experience I have ever purchased, but as they say, you get what you pay for. I bought two, and within two hours of delivery they were both back in the box, and were prommptly returned to the UPS store the very next morning. (Tracking shows both were returned to Amazon on 1/3/24, but only 1 of 2 has been "received" as of 1/25/24. Update: the 2of 2 was finally "received on  1/26/24. I've "chatted" five times with Amazon assuring me credit will be applied. Still waiting for Amazon to "receive" something that per UPS tracking they have had for 23 days. Then I get to wait another 5-7 days for the credit to be applied. Amazon customer service basically told me to eff off, dictated their super lame Amazon centric return policy, and to just wait out the 30 days. If I'm lucky I may get my refund sooner, but thus far nothing despite their repeated assurances.) Back to the TV, the Visio processor is painfully slow.  How slow?  Slower than molasses going uphill in the dead of winter in a bucket with a lid on it.  That's how slow.  Worse, the Visio simply won't stay on the settings you select. It turns itself off after set up forcing you to reinitiate every setting again and again. What about the picture? I really couldn't tell you. I spent all of my time repeatedly working through the menu. What about the remote?  Who cares at this point?  I couldn't get it back in the box fast enough.  I'm pleanty tech savvy, and I can easily manage all of the computers, routers, and other smart devices around my home. This Visio purchase was a complete waste of my time and money. Buyers remorse? You bet. 100% pure regret.  I don't see how anyone could possibly be expected to give this experience a positive review. Did I mention I'm still waiting for Amazon to refund my money?

I had recently moved my belongings from long-term storage and my old TV screen unfortunately cracked in the moving process. I needed to buy a new one, but was unable to spring for something super-expensive. I was drawn to this for the size and price point, and I was happy with my old VZIO model. I liked how I had the option to pay for the TV in installments, which increased the affordability for me.Setting it up was typical for new electronics — rather tedious — but once I got it set up, it was easy to log into my streaming apps. I do not have cable or play video games so I can’t speak to that, but it does seem capable.I use the TV in my bedroom and don’t need to keep the volume loud, but the sound does distort a little if I put it over 25. External speakers might fix the issue, but I don’t have any. Since I bought it in January, there have been two times in which the sound cuts off completely out of nowhere. This was annoying, but the old trick of turning it off, unplugging the power cord from the outlet, waiting a few mins, plugging the cord back in and turning the TV on worked each time. Just an inconvenience to consider.Sometimes I do have issues with the HBO app specifically, even after making sure everything is updated. I’m unsure as to why that happens.Overall, I wouldn’t use this TV in the living or family room, somewhere where it’d get a lot of constant use. But as an extra TV for the bedroom or office, it’s a good size. You get what you pay for.UPDATE 9/2022: Please don’t buy this TV! Don’t be roped in by the low price because you’ll end up paying more in the end by buying this. The return window is a joke (less than 1 month) and I can’t in good conscience try to sell this to some sorry soul on FB Marketplace or Craigslist.ALL streaming apps are super laggy, despite a strong connection to the fastest WiFi. The SmartCast Home Screen consistently has issues loading which, you know, is kind of important if you wish to use this TV for streaming (as most customers do). The remote has buttons for Disney Plus, Netflix, Amazon Prime, Pluto TV, iHeart Radio, Tubi, and Vizio’s WatchFree Plus app, which is convenient — but only when they work! Even when the Home Screen is down, those controls only decide to function 25% of the time.Don’t settle like I did - use your money elsewhere and invest in a TV that is reliable and that will work as advertised for longer than a few months. I now realize that TVs are a major investment. LEARN FROM MY MISTAKE - I implore you!

reviewTitle: Useless and Amazon customer service is terrible
reviewDescription: I bought this TV for my daughter's birthday on May 2. Her birthday wasn't until June 1st, so yea, my fault for buying so early. However, we were going on a couple vacations and I was trying to be ahead of the game. Anyway, we didn't actually use the TV until June 23 and I registered it with Vizio. Upon the 2nd day if using it, it disconnected from the network. I tried for an hour to get it back up and running. It wouldn't even recognize the wifi.
