I factory reset it, powered it down, messed with settings. Etc...  nothing. I reset the router and nothing. A few days later, reset it again and it worked.  Then 2 days after that, it disconnected again and I went through the same routine. I see that Amazon gives you a 90 day warranty. So I chatted and was told to contact the manufacturer.. seriously!? What kind of 90 day support is that? So I tried the TV again. Nothing works to get this TV to go on the network. $165 wasted. So I contact Amazon again.  I'm told that the 90 days is support.. ok I said, so if I still get support and it doesn't work, I should be able to return it. Right? Nope!! Call Vizio, I'm told again. Vizio put a ticket to help but I've heard nothing again about it. I just want to return the TV and buy my daughter a different brand TV that will cost more.. Amazon would make out on this deal, but they want to be difficult and not help a customer out. I understand the 30 day return policy but this TV is faulty and I should at least be able to return or replace.. Amazon is going down the tube and as much money as I spend .. an exception wouldn't hurt them, but it would mean a whole lot to me and a little girl who just wants to use her birthday present. Shame on Amazon for selling a faulty tv and not standing behind the product or having good customer service... I read in a lot of forums, that this TV has this known issue.. wish I knew before purchasing. So buyer beware!

I recently purchased a Vizio TV and have been thoroughly disappointed with my experience. First and foremost, the picture quality is subpar. Despite claims of high definition, the images are often fuzzy and lack clarity, making it difficult to enjoy my favorite shows and movies.Additionally, the sound quality leaves much to be desired. Even with the volume turned up, the sound is muffled and lacks depth, resulting in a less immersive viewing experience.Furthermore, the build quality of the TV is questionable. It feels flimsy and cheaply made, and I worry about its durability over time. The remote control is also poorly designed and often unresponsive, making navigation a frustrating ordeal.On top of the numerous disappointments with my Vizio TV, one of the most frustrating aspects is its inability to properly run streaming apps. Despite having a strong internet connection, none of the apps I wanted to use for watching movies and videos would load reliably. Whether it's Netflix, Hulu, or any other streaming service, I constantly encountered buffering issues and error messages, rendering the TV virtually useless for its primary purpose. It's incredibly frustrating to invest in a television only to be met with constant frustration and disappointment when trying to access basic entertainment services.Overall, I regret purchasing this Vizio TV and would not recommend it to others. Save yourself the disappointment and invest in a higher-quality television from a more reputable brand.

reviewTitle: UHF, Tin Foil & Rabbit Ears Works Better
reviewDescription: I expected better from Vizio. Older Vizio models on the same WiFi network have worked well for me, but model d24f-j09 is slow, and there’s a few bugs in the software.It takes on average 5 seconds for the channel guide to display, another 1.5 seconds for each channel to be highlighted as you channel surf. Up to 9 seconds before the channel selected displays.Apple AirPlay will work, but… Vizio will freeze and display a black screen if you select a different iPhone video to stream via airplay. The tv is non responsive and requires the power to be momentarily disconnected. There’s other software quirks I’ve noticed but didn’t write them down.Sound quality isn’t the best, it’s mostly fine but not for movies. I thought the Vizio soundbar SB2020n-j6 would improve sound but is all base, you’ll have to tweak the tv sound settings as there’s no presets I can find for vocal, music, or movies.The remote that comes with the tv is like most other remotes and poorly thought out with the button layout. Most people use tv remotes with one hand, this is awkward to do with the curved bottom and the numbers at the bottom of the remote. For single handed use you can’t easily press numbers with your thumb without dropping the remote. It’s a two handed remote for most people.This tv might be perfect for anyone wanting a small inexpensive tv that’s not too concerned with the issues I listed. The picture quality ain’t bad, the tv is just kinda of meh 🫤.Update: Sept 2023This Visio TV sucks. On a daily basis it locks up and stops working. It must be physically unplugged to reset it. It looses all the input options, network settings, everything…. Would rather go old school and use an analog tv.Update: March 2024Dark colors are heavily pixelated… Any movie scenes where the background is black or dark, the tv displays a heavily pixelated background.If a movie scene is filmed where the audience should see something emerging from the dark, you won’t see it on this tv. When the dragons eyes are seeing you from within the cave, you won’t know it until it breathes fire and illuminates a heavenly pixelated screen.🫤FYI - Walmart now owns Vizio. Expect more personalized ads and commercials via automatic content recognition (ACR), a kind of ad surveillance technology that is watching what you watch. 🤨

I chose this TV for it's price and the manufacturer's reputation, albeit some years back.  Received it in what looked like good condition, no beat up packaging.  All was fine until I began attempting to do the initial set up.  All it wanted was to do was get connected to my house wi-fi requiring passwords and other information.  I have never had to feed a new TV that kind of information before.  All I want to do is WATCH TV!  After a couple of days of trying to figure out how get through all this set up crap I was finally able to get on the right track of actually setting up the TV it kept asking the same questions and going in circles.  This thing is certainly NOT USER FRIENDLY.  After all this other crap now it's telling me that it can't find an HDMI-1 connection......which IS connected.  So now I have to go and buy another HDMI cable and see if that works.  Way too much trouble to go though just to be able to watch an endless stream of commercials.  PEssexA

reviewTitle: Maybe I got a bad one/ BUT VIZEO MADE IT RIGHT!
reviewDescription: I'm 67 and although not computer illiterate some of the new technology can be a challenge for me however this was incredibly easy to set up. But then I could not figure out how to get the sound on.. I watched every single video that there was about getting your sound to work troubleshooting what you could have done wrong what you need to change. Nothing worked. So I rarely ever do this but I took a chance and called them. Someone actually answered the phone and I actually had a decent conversation with this person who told me I needed to send my purchase information to a certain email which I did. I think that was 2 days ago and this afternoon I received a call from vizio. Unfortunately I was not able to take the call at the time but I will call back on friday. I'm just saying that this customer service is great and nothing like I have had  in years. I still don't know whether  they are going to help me fix his TV Thst I have only had. for about 40 days or provide ma  with a replacement or neither.But at least I've had positive experience so far.They did! Initially, they wanted me to give credit card information. Just in case I was scamming them. And I couldn't figure out how to get it in, so actually they sent me a replacement t. V trusting me to return the non-functional TV which I did. And I'm so grateful!And the reason why I couldn't return It through Amazon. Was because I had been in the hospital and By the time I got out of the hospital. I was past the 30 day return window and this is how I wound up getting the assistance.And the replacement from vizio!!

reviewTitle: Very Glitchy and comically slow, when it works at all
reviewDescription: I’ve had to factory reset this tv multiple times. It’s glitchy and very slow. It has jammed up several times, during its first week with me it kept resetting itself so i had to sign into my accounts again and again. It will tell me it can’t find the network even though it shows that it’s connected. I periodically have to turn it off and then back on to restart it when it jams. It’s iffy about casting, sometimes it works, sometimes it jams up. I told customer service about this, it was a refurbished Amazon deal, and though I told them I’d already factory reset it several times. So they told me to factory reset it, so very helpful. I just gave up. I’d already thrown out the packaging by the time it started glitching so shipping it back was going to be hard anyway. At least it’s cheap, but it’s definitely cheap for a reason. The picture is good from the front but dims from slightly to the side. If you’re very patient with this special needs tv, its fine but I don’t recommend it. You can’t switch between screens very quickly, the processor is obviously junk. I checked online and these issues are common with this tv. I’ve had 2 other Vizio tvs, my oldest one is the best by far, it’s 10 years old and even now it’s far better than this one. Not going to buy a refurbished item againUpdate: when I turn the volume up or down it usually doesn’t register right away but like 3-10 seconds later the volume will start changing. If someone who doesn’t know this tries to change the volume, they’ll over press the button trying to get it to work and in 5-10 seconds it’ll get going and go way loud or way quiet.Final update: after almost three months this tv is still acting up. Some days it just won’t work and I have to unplug it for ten minutes. Then it works. I really got a bad tv. But looks like tons of people got good ones so I guess just hope you’re luckier than me :)

What I previously wrote about the Vizio TV (Below), I'd add that we have figured it out a bit better, and have found the setting that will take the TV to the previously used app or funsction each time it is powered up.  That helps...Previous post: This TV is too complicated for normal people who just want to watch tv.  We want a TV that allows for watching broadcast TV using an antenna, but every time you go to the input for "Antenna", your antenna channels are sort of available  but nearly impossible to directly access chanels, and there's all this "watch free" stuff mixed in.  Tons of other channels from the internet mixed in with the antenna channels making simple viewing of standard broadcast channels a difficult task.  Why (WHY!) can't the input source labled ANTENNA just have the antenna stations!?We also watch YouTubeTV, another pain in the butt with this Vizio.  The platform they give for the YTTV App is also a total pain to navigate.  You are better off with a normal TV, and just use a Chromecast.I wish I sent it back right away, but we just got the big, new antenna hooked up today and discovered these other issues out too lateEverything about setting this tv up was a pain, and trying to learn how to use it is challenging to say the least.  My partner Phyllis has even greater difficulities with it.  We will be dumping this Vizio and will likely buy another Insignia.

Most remotes have a TV button......not Vizio.  Who needs a TV button when you can torment the customer by not being able to turn on your TV without going thru a menu every time you want to watch TV?  Press a button and wait 30 seconds for the TV to respond.  I swore I would never buy another vizio before I purchased this one.  But I thought....maybe they changed their evil ways.Out of the box, it was manageable.  TV on power up was a General Setting.  But then came the "update".  And everything changed.  Now instead of the TV turning on, you get a Watchfree menu that takes 30 seconds to appear.  Then you have to go through the tv guide to pick a channel.  INSANITY.  STAY AWAY FROM VIZIO.  NEVER NEVER NEVER NEVER EVER BUY A VIZIO PRODUCT UNLESS YOU DON'T MIND TYING YOUR NEW TV TO THE REAR BUMPER OF YOUR CAR AND DRIVING it TO THE OCEAN TO THROW IT IN.  NO TV BUTTON ON A TV REMOTE... HOW CAN A COMPANY BE SO STUPID?Oh by the way, you know how the white channel number shows up in the corner of the screen when you change the channels so you can know what channel you are watching?  On this piece of garbage, the channel numbers are only .25 inch tall.  Not even readable when sitting in your chair.Update may 31 2031.  Now there is no way to know what channel you are watching because they took the .25" channel numbers off the screen.  Insanity.Update 9/18/2023.  5 inch black stripe in the middle of the screen.  Vizio is complete GARBAGE.
It looks s exactly what I ordered and it came quickly. Once I figured out how to really work it it is truly a bang for my buck.

reviewTitle: Very nice product for the price!
reviewDescription: Easy to assemble the legs. Setup went smooth. Very nice picture. For the price you can’t beat it. Would buy it again!
It was a gift to a senior.
Great tv for the money, don’t even hesitate for a bedroom tv

24" great little smart tv for kids rooms. I ended up buying another for the other kid. Connects to all our streaming services and they can easily search for something without having to go into each app. It connected to the Xbox easily. Lots of flexibility on personalizing it, so the kids love them. We ended up buying a larger one for the living room since these little guys were so awesome and you can't beat the price.
Easy to use, vibrant, great value
Very happy with product
Easy to operate
Easy to use.  Set up was also very easy.
Bought this for our daughter and grandson they love it. The picture is fantastic  highly recommend

The picture is really good and the size was spot on.  We have only streaming channels and it can be a tiny bit slower than with cable but it's soo worth it!  The only problem is the legs are kinda flimsy so think about a wall mount for safety reasons.

Bought this tv some months back and was impressed with the picture quality.  The tuner seems sensitive enough to bring in OTA signals well enough for stable picture.The only issues I have with this television is sometimes it tends to freeze.  When this happens the remote becomes inoperative and the only way to recover operation is to unplug the set for a few minutes.  Otherwise it does just fine.
Nice picture, works great
Great picture on TV, however, the sound or volume was very low.  Looks like it needs a sound bar to improve the volume.

Very good picture for the price. It is Easy to set up, even with just one person. TV start up was easy to navigate through. It comes with preloaded programs to chose from, with some variety. It's readily adaptable to individual preferences. The remote is straightforward, and not overly complicated.

Like the title says, I waited about 2 months to leave a review. The TV is good for the low price. My remote works fine, I know some people have said theirs lost power after a week. I wish the settings were better, though.
It is very good for the price I paid but if you're used to watching oled tv it might take some getting used to to truly appreciate it.

I really liked this tv .I didn't like the picture on it to good seemed a little blurry to me and a few others .overall though really good TV and good price .came delivered with care from mailman .was in perfect condition not a scratch on it ,nice looking tv too perfect for my bedroom ,not to big amd bulky bit ay the same  time not to small ,easy to operate ,i eas happy with this purchase
Tv is fine; waaay too small for room I had intended it for

Perfectly shipped and easy to set up. This is my 4th Vizio and happy with the purchase. The only feature they could have added to get a 5 would be the voice option on the remote. I have seen that on the LG brand. Considering the price, that is a reasonable expectation.

Vizio tv repeatedly reverts to Vizio as cable provider. Only purchase this TV if you enjoy continually going to back of TV to change input plug. Vizio designed their TV’s this way!!! Very difficult to override the system but there are video’s to help😫

We had a surge protector for our tv, and my daughter turned it on and a big spark came from the tv and stopped working. Very disappointed in the quality of the tv and how i was ignored when I tried resolving the issue.

reviewTitle: WORST TV EVER!!!  Read the other reviews.
reviewDescription: WORST TV EVER!!!  Read the other reviews.First problem, no channels found when doing a channel scan. Tried 6 cable outlets in our house and wit didn't work. I contacted customer support and, after troubleshooting, was sent another TV. Same problem.Months later the TV got an update. No channels found on initial search. But "find additional channels" did find channels. Worked for one day, now it says No Video on the cable channels. But WatchFree works.When turning on the TV, it goes straight to WatchFree. You cannot use the channel up/down button to change cable/antenna channels.  To change cable channels you need to enter the number on the remote, which opens a keypad on the screen. You must arrow up/down to select enter, to get to the channel.Just awful!

The TV might be smart, but not the folks who boxed it up. Before something is shipped, can y'all at least look to see if it's complete??? A checklist might have been useful. Item might actually work, but who knows without a remote?

It broke within 10 days. Initially ViZIO was wonderful to work with ( and US based CSR). Since that first call, I’ve gotten nothing but big fibs. Just told that replacement won’t get here for another 5 days. Can’t get money back unless I buy a box to mail it back ( threw out the box when we set it up, didn’t anticipate having to return it). Didn’t cost much so I got what I paid for .. crap.. Never again will I buy a TV from Vizio . Should have gone to brick and mortar… lesson learned. Replacement arrived 1/19 and set up easily.

Got the 24” for my daughters bedroom. From day one there was problems but they were at random times. First the remote wouldn’t work, tried 3 different brands of brand new batteries- same effect, still didn’t work. Then, couldn’t turn the tv off, every few days had to  unplug it in order to get it to power off. Then it would boot on as soon as it was plugged back in, without hitting the power button. I contemplated sending it back but since it was a holiday gift by the time she opened it, we were already past the return window. Still have problems more often than I would like to admit, had to plug it into a surge protector with a longer cord so I don’t have to keep moving the dresser it sits on just to unplug it and plug it back in. It constantly freezes up in apps. Most of the time hitting the home button seems to reset the functionality, at least for the moment. Have also ran into setting it up from scratch a few time when turning it on, not sure how it wiped out the Wi-Fi network. Not a good experience. First and last time I buy this brand!

If I had a do over I NEVER WOULD HAVE BOUGHT THIS TV.  I SHOULD NOT HAVE TO AGREE TO ANY TERMS OF SERVICE TO USE MY TV.  I WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHWR VISIO AGAIN. I WANT MY MONEY BACK COME AND GET THIS POS.

I bought this tv 4 months ago and I’m already having trouble with it. There’s time when the control will stop working and it won’t work on mobile app so i have  to unplug tv because the power button won’t respond in order to get it working again.  Volume is way too low so we have to have it on 30s so it’ll be decent enough to hear.

reviewTitle: WEAK WI-FI CAPABILITIES, DROPS WI-FI CONSTANTLY
reviewDescription: Don’t buy this TV - it constantly drops the wifi and then it just becomes useless. I do have reliable Wi-Fi (AT&T) that works well will all my devises: laptops, phones, IPads, two other smart TVs and others. When it connects is a good TV though, just needs to connect !  Unfortunately I waited to long to returns so more likely it will end up in the trash :-(

So glitchy, doesn’t respond to remote commands on the app or the physical remote. Can’t watch anything on it really without it stopping 50 times throughout. Biggest regret was this purchase. Don’t waste your money or time

reviewTitle: system updates ruined it. in trash after 14 months or so.
reviewDescription: System updated changed the functionality of the screen from a very simple layout to a very busy layout, and when it did so the tv became painfully slow to even change channels (like 3-5 seconds).  Second Vizio we've had go out after a comparably short time compared to TV's we've owned over 50 years. Done with the brand, never again.
Got this because it was cheap- not worth it. Always glitches, freezes, will randomly turn off, the user experience isn’t great either on their home page. Do not recommend and want my money back.

I followed the Quick Connect Set Up and received an Error Code "unable to connect to Vizio SmartCast" a SmartTV. I reset and tried again same error code. I contacted the online support listed on the Quick Connect Guide "Support.vizio.com" a chat line. The 3rd questioned wanted my credit card number. The chatline stopped and would not proceed with credit card number. I called the 1-877 listed #. Another mistake}  It took a painful hour to communicate with broken english and download updates required updates that did not load. A very unprofessional help center with loud background noise that interfered with solving my connection issue.So frustrated with Vizio Support Staff I'm ready to return product

Had too reconnect to WIFI  almost every time I turned set on. Would pause and freeze during streaming for up to 3 minutes, spinning circle in center of screen. May be isolated to this 1 set but replacement, Hi Sense has no problem with WIFI. Shows signal is  strong and has never paused or frozen.

Not as good as advertised. Remote and functions are confusing, and more complex than a previous Vizio tv I had to replace. Just another reason to NOT shop on line. Pig in a poke syndrome, had I had the chance to examine this tv before I bought it I would not have done so.

I owned this TV just over 30 days and now it does not turn on all it does is the power light just blinks. This TV went out just after the 30 return policy so this company ripped me off and now I can't return the TV. Complete garbage. Buyer beware. Vizio is 100% garbage. This TV barely lasted just over a month this TV is 100 percent garbage. This TV deserves zero stars and beware vizio will not help with the garbage they and amazon sells. This TV as absolute garbage. Absolutely trash TV and garbage vizio customer service. Should have the option to rate zero stars for this company and their product. Vizio product and customer service are garbage.

Seems like a great TV at a size that's not very common. But they really should be doing everything they can to get Xfinity, the country's largest internet and cable TV provider (and owner of Peacock, NBC, Universal, etc.) to make an app on their platform. I guess it's Xfinity's choice to make the app, but it's Vizio's failure. The Xfinity Stream app is available on South Korea's LG and Samsung TVs, why not America's Vizio?That they actually tell you to cast the Xfinity app from another device or use a Roku is a little sad. "With our TV, you have to start up an extra device to watch cable TV—you can even give Xfinity more money by renting another box!"I did try plugging the TV directly into the wall, but it only picked up 2 digital channels and one analog channel out of the 185+ we get from Xfinity. None of them worked.Finally, the remote has six streaming-service-specific buttons Disney+, Netflix, Amazon Prime (fine) and Pluto, iHeart Radio, and Tubi (wha—?)I will be returning this for an LG or Samsung smart TV.

reviewTitle: Was sent a broken or defective tv
reviewDescription: I like that my previous review was removed, vizio is garbage and so is the support. Amazon support doesn't get much better. Crazy how a rich company can be so cheap.
I hate the stands I am returning because the stand and screws won't screw in correctly and the TV is wobbly...
NEED TO RETURN THIS VIZO TV DARK LINES IN THE BOTTOM OF THE SCREEN SUDDENLY SHOWED UP SHOULD NOT BE THERE

Worked fine for a couple of weeks then would not power up.  I tried all the system resets offered by you tube and customer support.  Nothing worked and I threw away the original packaging, even though I’m still within the 69 day return period, so too bad for me.

Was excited to get this based on reviews. However the TV is constantly stopping and crashing from apps to the home screen.  Shows lag for no real reason. We check the internet connecting everything else is running fine just this TV doesn't.  Regret this purchase so so much!!

The smart features did not work on the TV. I spent hours with their technical support to no avail. I would normally NOT purchase such an off market product but did so bc i was told the live TV feature would play my "local" news. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT

Do not buy this TV. Spend a couple extra dollars and get one that works. I got this for my daughters dorm and it will not connect to Wi-Fi. We have tried EVERYTHING!  Amazon replaced the TV…. Not the problem. Tried to get an Ethernet….no port. Tried to get a usb to Ethernet adapter… doesn’t work.  All of her other roommates have tvs and theirs work, a couple are Vizio too. Bottom line, this is a cheap tv that may work in perfect conditions. I have spent way too much time messing with this and sincerely wish I had researched better and not bought the lowest end tv made.

reviewTitle: POS.. you get what you pay for
reviewDescription: Temperamental, forces you to use features that you do not want to use, and if you do not use them, the TV is very difficult to enjoy. Wi-Fi network is connected but the TV tells you it is not, local channels selected, but you cannot watch them unless you sign onto Watch For Free, and even then the direct to channels tNew York stations even though you enter your local ZIP Code. When you do get local TV channels to work, the TV will not allow sound to come through. Although a quality name, this particular TV is a total, POS, frustrating, and unfortunately where we have installed, we did not use it until way past the 30 days so now we are stuck with it. Free TV call me and it’s yours.!!

I've bought this same model twice, and both have not worked properly.  The first would not fire up the screen after a couple of days.  The replacement (no problem with return) degraded over time, with a slow boil of troublesome issue.  It started by losing connections, then took repeated attempts to start, then required multiple "tricks" to get it going such as start, unplug, wait, restart, and repeat if necessary, and finally no sound.  It also always had a lot of difficulty connecting to Apple airpods.  And now it's out of warranty. Along the way the picture was fine and the sound tinny (it's a small TV; my expectations were low anyway). Should have returned before warranty expired; will never buy a Vizio again.

reviewTitle: TV no longer turns on after barely a month
reviewDescription: I’ve had this tv since the beginning of December, and now it won’t turn on. I’ve unplugged it, plugged it back in, used different outlets, etc. It won’t turn on. Very disappointing because I thought Vizio was a decent brand when I purchased.

This TV is slow and often loses the wifi. It also only plays espn in Spanish even though everything else is in English. Sorry I bought it. It's only a couple of months old and I'm probably going to throw it out.

reviewTitle: Air play doesn’t work on cirri. Channels.
reviewDescription: I use the spectrum app to cast tv shows, movies, etc… to my tv. Certain channels will not cast to the TV but they all work on other TV. I had the same problem with an 40 inch Vizio I bought.

reviewTitle: Will not connect to a WPA3
reviewDescription: This tv is not set up for a WPA3 connection in my garage. 👎🏼 Sending back.

reviewTitle: using apps only then tv is ok — if you want to use Internet TV (IPTV) this has horrible usability
reviewDescription: · horrible UI and Usability for IPTV or Antenna TV — it takes several clicks to get to a one click function, even when you have a "one-click" button like the "watch free+" — you can't set defaults like favorite(s) channels and have it start a your favorite channels, the IPTV Guide takes about 4 different forms and they are not easily accessible and and not at all user friendly. If you just want to use the OTA channels it is just as unfriendly and difficult. this device is not for anyone who is not well experienced with bad UI and Usability.· If you are just using it for the ports, or apps, or as a monitor then you may find it serves you just fine.· would return it if it wasn't so much trouble to do so.— UPDATE: did return tv after 3 weeks — usability/UI is intolerable.TV was returned and replaced.

I’ve had a Vizio in the past that I really liked. It was a 30” smart tv and never had any problems. I tried cancelling this purchase right away but since it came anyways I thought I’d at least try it out. The system would not connect to my building WIFI right away and took multiple tries. And the WiFi in my building had just been updated so I know that wasn’t the problem. After finally connecting to my WiFi a couple hours later, the system took a half a day to update itself in order for me to be able to use it. Not worth the frustration. Remote doesn’t connect as well as it should when using the tv, some buttons need to be pressed multiple times. Definitely returning or selling.

reviewTitle: Do NOT buy this!!!**update 8/4** tv just completing quit working
reviewDescription: Updating my review because I think people should know. TV barely over 1yr old. Has completely quit working!! All I have is a black screen. Contacted Vizio. They said “they know about the problem and are working to solve the issue” I said “ So this TV is useless until you fix the problem?!” She said “No worries, we’ll notify you when it’s been fixed” So all I can say is, buy ANY other TV other than this one. It’s complete junk!! Had problems at the start. Then intermittently over the year. Now it doesn’t work at all!!!!!! Bought a new TV and this one will be going to the garbage and will never buy another Vizio again. I always try to have something positive to say. So I thought really hard and came up with nothing. It was difficult/time consuming to set up. Took almost hour to update everything. Keep doing it over and over again. Hulu doesn’t work! Hour long chat with hulu to find out there’s a “known issue with Vizio tvs “ and they’re working on it. So if want to be able to stream Hulu-this is NOT the TV for you. Also. If you lose wifi, the tv won’t do anything. You won’t even be able to switch it over to watch tv. Just has a blank grey screen saying “searching for network”. Really trying to decide if I even want to keep it. I hooked up a Roku so I could watch all my subscriptions I pay for but there’s only 2 hdmi ports so had to unplug dvd for that to work. I bought a TV that had all these apps so I could eliminate the roku and sadly, I still have to use it to watch what I want. Overpriced for what it is!!!! **4/4/22 update. I contacted Vizio and they sent out a “patch” and had me change the language back n forth and restart tv and now Hulu works!!! Frustrating to have to mess with all the phone calls etc and that it took them so long to fix it. But the TV works perfect now so I’m updating my review**

DO NOT BUY!  DO NOT BUY!It's nice and cheap but NOT worth the headache.  Once it's connected to a network it will not work after being disconnected.  It will not reconnect automatically and just constantly searches for a network and does not allow you to change settings while it searches.  It took me an hour to try and put in a password to a new network just so I could access the settings to do a factory reset.  There is absolutely NO service help available.  Thank God I bought it on Amazon and can return it for free.  DO NOT BUT THIS TV!!

reviewTitle: Quality Control Seems to Have Plummeted
reviewDescription: When I broke my original Vizio by accident, it seemed a no-brainer to replace it with a newer one. I had no idea how wrong that was going to be. The screen has a band of dark, muddled color running down the middle third of the screen. It affects everything. Highlighted text isn't consistent the way it is on other TVs. The flat gray of the photo screen is a jumbled mess of splotchy grays. Don't buy this TV. It might be fine, or you might find a few months down the line you regret the purchase when you can't return it. Whatever Vizio is doing for quality control, it isn't working.

reviewTitle: Have to have Internet to set up this tv
reviewDescription: If you want a TV for over the air antenna tv ? This is NOT the TV for you. This TV needs an Internet connection to get past the setup menu. I had to hotspot my phone. It took about an hour to get the tv "setup". The TV SPIES on you and says so, it collects anything you type, search, watch, etc. Several screens pop up you have to agree to it spying on you. Every time I turn ON this TV, it takes a long time because it only cares about being hooked to the Internet and spying. I have to make it show antenna tv. Like all electronics these days, the 1st priority is to keep up with YOU and what you do with it, 2nd is actually being a TV to watch. I HATE this TV

reviewTitle: This Is Not A Technologically Intelligent TV
reviewDescription: I'm not sure what to say other than the overall experience with this TV is terrible.  It does not connect to 5G networks, it does not provide software/apps for you to be able to connect to your own NAS. The remote has no play, fast forward, or rewind buttons so whatever app you're in either can pick up where you're attempting to navigate to or it flat out doesn't. I don't like it at all, for a smart TV - it has set me back years.  I have Non/Smart TV's that use a firestick or Roke and work better.

I wanted so much to like this TV which replaced my 28 inch RCA in my bedroom. The first one arrived and it was set up by the Comcast agent in my community. After it was off during the night and I turned it on the next morning there was a white flash of light which covered the entire screen. I thought it was a fluke until it happened every night. I planned to return it to Amazon. I ordered the exact same one again and the same thing happened.Today I returned both TVs to the local UPS store, and the agent there said that she and her husband had bought a Vizio TV and the same white flash happened. I was so happy to see my RCA pal again who is now at home. I hope people who purchase this have a better experience. I have another Vizio in my den that is about 8-years- old and not one issue. Good luck

It's been YEARS since I've had a new TV and needed one badly. I purchased this VIZIO TV on October 11, 2023. When it arrived on October 21, 2023, I had no issues with it. I was pleased with my purchase. The picture quality was decent, the TV remote and remote app worked, and I had no issues with the installed apps. (I was disappointed that Spotify isn't included, but that's not a major deal-breaker.)However, 3 months later all of that changed. My TV remote responds slower whenever I press the buttons, the remote app doesn't work at all anymore, and after my TV automatically updated, I no longer have access to certain apps, like Movies Anywhere.It's too late for me to return this TV, so I'm heavily considering trading this TV for a better one. I'm displeased with ordering this VIZIO TV. This was my first purchase from this company. And it will be my LAST!

reviewTitle: Internet Stability was bad but only on this device.
reviewDescription: Internet Stability was bad but only on this device. My wifi worked well with every other device phone computer etc but the tv was having connection issues regularly. It also has a bunch of unwanted ads. I'd sometimes be startled by the sounds of the home page if i slept with the tv still on mind you im a deep sleeper who sleeps with the tv on or music playing so its pretty loud. It will also automatically bring you to the home screen if youre on hdmi trying to avoid those ads.

reviewTitle: poor sound quality but overall fine
reviewDescription: The sound vibrates and hums as if the bass is too high but adjusting the bass does not help. There are no sound setting adjustments I can make that will fix it.  It happens during certain noise/sound levels like music or sound effects.  Very annoying to me.  So far have not been able to set up a bluetooth speaker instead-don't think its bluetooth capable.  Otherwise the TV works well, good picture, no other complaints.

reviewTitle: Long setup; Not all apps available
reviewDescription: TV itself came in perfect condition and with everything needed. Good audio and picture quality. I found the setup process very long but not difficult. My fault for not researching, but I was surprised to find that some apps are not available and cannot be added. It is fairly inexpensive to get a Roku or Fire Stick etc. to get access, but might have changed my decision to purchase if I knew.

reviewTitle: Vizio watch free+ and over the air channels is a “bust”!
reviewDescription: Overall I thought this tv was going to be a good tv.  I wanted to watch over the air free tv channels and one of the latest updates now merges over the air channels in with Vizio Watchfree+ app and makes it difficult to watch JUST the over the air channels, because they are part of the WatchFree+, so when you choose the input of antenna it defaults to the Vizio WatchFree+ which means if you have internet connection it is using data for this app.  According to what other people said, this is not how it used to be, as you used to be able to choose Input of antenna and watch JUST over the air channels without having the Zivio WatchFree+ load as well.  This is cumbersome and not user friendly and freezes at times, especially if you are in an area of poor or no internet because then it just spins onscreen trying to connect.  If Vizio doesn’t address this, it makes this tv kind of useless for over the air, which is one main reason I bought it to use while camping in areas where there is little to no internet but access to over the air channels.  I do like the built in Air Play and have added a Roku stick to it which seems to work.  Picture quality is just ok unless it is a good HD channel.  Sound is tinny at best when you go higher in volume.  If it wasn’t for this debacle watching local channels I would be somewhat satisfied, but right now I wish I spent the extra money and bought a Samsung or other brand without this app issue.  Vizio - PLEASE CHANGE THIS!

So this TV overall it’s pretty good TV but thing is with the auto receiver and stuff like that with the remote it has a slow reaction it’s delayed when you click the button on the remote when you try to turn the volume you have to hold it down for like five seconds, and then the volume will pop up on the screen But I like the fact that when I turn on my PlayStation five, it automatically switches HDMI to the PlayStation but other than that if you want a fast TV this wouldn’t be the choice if you want TV that’s just reliable and good enough maybe something to put your kids room  or guestroom. Perfect TV.

reviewTitle: A mix of good and bad
reviewDescription: We’ve had the tv for several months now.  The overall value is good and at a fair price. The picture is very good…clean, sharp, good color. The WiFi connection gets lost often and we have to unplug and replug to get it to reconnect. The Home Screen interface is slow to respond as is the volume adjustment. Also, the Home Screen is not customizable. The sound quality is shallow.

I didn't expect much from this TV because of the low price and my expectations were accurate.The picture quality is fine enough but the sound quality is truly horrible, as is the remote for controlling the sound.This was supposed to be a master bedroom TV but will now go into one of the guest bedrooms while I search for a better replacement.

reviewTitle: Not easy to switch between streaming apps and local TV stations
reviewDescription: My main TV is a Sony OLED Bravia TV. I LOVE it. It is easy to use. There is a TV a button on the remote. If I want to watch a local TV station I select TV on remote and the stations show on the bottom of the screen. The last channel I was on immediately comes up. I can arrow left or right to change channels. This Vizio TV does not have a TV button on remote. It isn’t easy to go to TV. It’s a multi step process and is a lot of work and the last channel viewed does not come up. I will probably be returning it because of this.

We have two fire tv's, an LG, and this vizio; as well as a full smathome setup and numerous other devices. This tv is the only device that has issues connecting to the internet. I have to make numerous attempts to get it to connect every time I turn it on. Once it's connected it works okay. It's slow, but it's also not a high end tv. I like the ease of use if you aren't struggling to connect.

The TV is quite nice. It has a great picture for its size, but it is a little delayed with remote commands from both the physical remote and the phone app. Screen mirroring is only available for Apple products. There are not many apps available in the Vizio app store, but there are some good ones.

reviewTitle: This is what Hitler would have sold if he had won the war.
reviewDescription: Difficult to set up and presents a multitude of privacy waivers. If you don't agree you lose most functionality.  I have 50 years of experience as a digital computer technician and I haven't figured the setup out yet, especially after being bombarded with signing away my 4th Amendment right to privacy.

reviewTitle: 5 out of 10 times when turned on no picture or sound.
reviewDescription: WORSE TV I'VE EVER PURCHASED.  From day one I've had nothing but problems with this tv.  When I turn it on there's often no picture.  It has to be turned off and back on around 3 to 5 times.  Around every other day it goes through a Vizio update so if you're hoping to catch something on tv like a football game, you'll have to wait until it goes through the update.  Once the update is done and it turns itself off even though it's supposed to restart and stay on, there's no sound.  I have to unplug the tv for about 30 seconds and switch the HDMI port to get it to work.  Keep in mind I've had this tv for around 2 weeks.  DO NOT BUY THIS TV.  Great price but you're buying a tv that will fail in my opinion.  JUNK!!

Tested the TV before mounting it to ensure it turned on, no damage, etc.Once mounted, followed the prompts and it began updating. Walked away for a moment and BOOM. It turned off and no matter what troubleshooting I do, the SOB won’t turn on again. Vizio customer support is not available when you need them, which is endlessly frustrating. Do not buy this TV.I will now have to unmount this TV, box it up, return it, and purchase a new one. NOT a fun task.

reviewTitle: Should have bought something else, knew it was too good to be true for the price
reviewDescription: Took but about 3 days for the TV to start freezing, not turning on, and having other issues.For example what inspired me to write this review tonight was that the TV had 0 inputs listed when I had attempted to swap inputs. It showed the input selection box but it was completely empty this time (while normally even with nothing plugged in, there were a few inputs listed even if nothing was plugged into them.)After trying to turn the TV off, that's where it all went wrong. The tv became complete unresponsive and refused to turn back on. It took 5 to 6 times of unplugging power to finally have a successful boot but I have no idea how long this successful boot will last.My main tv is a 65" visio that has very little to no issues, however this tv at a bargain rate of $170 for a 40" just doesn't seem worth it for the issues it already... definitely have trusted visio in the past but I've been quite let down by this model so far....Would rather not have to return this tv but one more night of me taking 20 minutes of trying to figure out why it won't do a basic thing like swap inputs, and it's getting a full return.

I am disabled and bought this tv 2.5 months ago.  It was nice but as you can see the pictures now bad.  Nothing has occurred it was delivered to my home.  Everything was fine until yesterday.  I’m trying to get the seller but of course I can’t.  I spent a third of my disability check on this tv because I’m home a lot.  I don’t have the money to repair it so i have no tv now.

reviewTitle: Has a mind of its own
reviewDescription: This Vizio 40-inch tv is unpredictable.  I bought it to fit inside a bedroom armoire so I didn't have to look at a black hollow on my wall.  It fits exactly as I wanted.  HOWEVER, I only want to use a Firestick or over-the-air antenna for viewing.  I set it to power up to the last Input used but it only does that about 20% of the time.  It defaults to  SMARTCAST or Watchfree when powered up, both of which require wi-fi.  I don't have it connected to my wi-fi, so I get an error screen.  I don't even have the Firestick connected, yet it often defauts to HDMI-1 input.  It took about 3 weeks to just get this far.  Do not buy this if you don't want to use smart-tv functions.

For the love of god buy anything else but this piece of garbage. Every 4hth time I turn this thing on it can't  detect my connected blu ray player.  I have to spend 20 minutes forcing the tv to reset multiple times before it can detect the blu ray player again. The player and cable it uses works flawlessly on my other TV so they aren't the problem.  I watch all my programs through the blu ray player so this is a major inconvenience.  It's also an ordeal to get it to connect to anything online. BUY SOMETHING ELSE! SAVE YOURSELF SOME AGGRAVATION.

This TV has all the components of a great tv. It has a great picture, good sound quality, and SmartTV abilities. However, to be a great tv all of those things need to function. We’ve had issues since the second day we received this tv. The Vizio SmartTV platform is absolutely terrible. Certain applications (HBO Max for one) would cause the TV to freeze, volume couldn’t be adjusted, and we’d have to restart the tv by unplugging it. We decided, because the picture quality was so good, to opt to purchase an Amazon Firestick instead of using the Smartcast feature that comes on the TV. This seemed like a viable solution but unfortunately did not solve the issues. Because the tv defaults to Smartcast when you turn it on (despite the menu allowing you to select a different turn on input - it never saves, always reverts back to Smartcast) we still experience freezing. This happens just about every time the tv is turned off or if you try to change the input. Because we wanted to try the Firestick we missed the return window and when I spoke with Vizio’s customer service/tech support they simply couldn’t help me. They went through the same “resolution” steps over and over and over despite me telling them I was getting the same result each time. I’m not sure if we just got a lemon or if this is is a problem that others have experienced, but I would NOT recommend or repurchase this tv. We have to unplug it multiple times per day for it to function.

Failed after 30 day return period.  Won't turn on with remote after several attempts.  When finally turns on, setting defaults to first input selection, requiring to change input back to original source.  Fails consistently over and over suddenly.  New batteries in Cox remote did not matter.Same thing happened to another Vizio 32" TV in other room of the house purchased from Costco.  Too late to return to Costco also.  That TV would not turn on either, and only after several attempts, finally did turn on, but required reset of input to desired viewing source.  Changing batteries in Cox remote did not matter.  This TV is the third one and it is still not working properly.BOTH of these TVs are quirky at best, and so prevalent in their misbehavior that there are numerous postings on these issues on the web.  Seems to me that Vizio could have fixed these issues instead of populating the web with fix issues, that seem to me to recurring, not permanent, such as resetting the TV back to factory defaults.  This requires all your settings to be redone each time the TV is reset.  This has never happened to the many Samsung TVs we've owned over the years.UPDATE ~ March 7, 2023:Both TVs suddenly work now as they should.  No idea what happened.

reviewTitle: Worse TV I have ever Owned
reviewDescription: I don't normally do reviews but I have had this TV for almost a year now, and hands down it is one of the worse TV's I have ever owned.The response time the controller gives out to the tv is absolutely horrible. New batteries in the remote after taking the old batteries out, made it not even respond. The picture quality feels like something from the year 2000. My computer monitor looks and feels better than the tv itself.... Price wise both about the same.Would not recommend and will not buy another Vizio TV again.

reviewTitle: Impossible to link to Alexa Dot Speakers!
reviewDescription: UPDATE - YES THE TV HAS BEEN RETURNED:  I bought this TV and the Echo Dot which was recommended so that I can control the TV.  Well, VIZIO TV does allow me to turn the TV on and off, but does not allow me to use the dot as a speaker!!  I've spent all evening trying to get it to use the dot as a speaker, and if I can't get it done easily tomorrow it's going back, this is ridiculous.  I went on UT for answers and everyone says that Vizio is very difficult to connect your external devices, and nowhere is there a Bluetooth setting on the VIZIO that would make it extremely simple.
The delivery box was  just fine, but when we took it out to install, the TV is severely damaged. No idea how that can happen.

The unit came without any instructions except putting tje legs on which I did. When powered, only wierd colors  showed up. When I entered the unit code on the side into the vizio website, it did mot recognize the code. This TV was bought to replace an identical sized 4 year old vizio which had  starting blinking but worked without problems out of the box. .

When using the antenna, the picture will just freeze but the sound will continue to play normally.  If you change the channel it will unfreeze the picture BUT good luck knowing what channel you are even on because they took that feature away and it no longer displays on the screen!Two months into using this tv the speakers started to buzz intermittently so I called customer service.  Did all the steps, etc. hung up and it immediately started buzzing again.  Called again the following week, did all the steps, factory reset, had to re login to all my apps etc.  Still. Buzzing.Called back to customer service, they now want to send a repair guy to my home to fix the TV.  At this point all the time I've spent dealing with this and will have to spend more time dealing with a repair guy far outweighs what I paid for this TV.  Very disappointed.
This TV is less than 60 months old and there is always one sort of lag between the remote & the t.v. would not recommend
Purchased in December - stopped working in March ! 3 months lifespan, don’t waste your money. I will be disputing this and getting a refund

Absolutely frustrating!  It can't hold onto the wifi connection and all I wanted was a TV for off-the-air monitoring of one channel!  The issue is that you can't just turn it on to watch TV.  Every single time you turn it on if makes you go through these varying screens of trying to setup wifi and accept terms of use.  I just want a TV that plays the same off-the-air channel when I turn it on!  And Vizio's online support is useless with no contact information.
DO NOT BUY THIS TV. YOU WILL REGRET IT. this TV constantly freezes and you and Sutton there waiting for sound and moving picture to resume. I missed the return window. This TV is awful

You can’t download apps unless you use a firestick or something similar. I use Philo and have to spend more on another gadget to use it. Airplay constantly drops. The remote has no mic. The back button is down towards the lower portion of the remote so I’m constantly hitting the settings button that’s where most remotes put their back button. If it wasn’t mounted to my wall I would probably throw it out the window. This thing won’t last long with me. It’s a garbage user experience.

Sound randomly stops working.  When we use the TV for cable and shut the TV off and turn it back on later, it goes back to the TV main menu for streaming instead of taking us back to cable.  I bought this for my elderly mother and it's just too complicated for her to be changing settings etc.  Overall bad purchase.

reviewTitle: Go with something else. Wish I could return it still.
reviewDescription: It is a tv and the smart function is there but is so clunky it’s aggravating to use. It randomly turns itself on from five minutes to an hour after I turn it off. I mostly use it as a monitor for my computer. I wish I’d gone with a different tv.

reviewTitle: This Is THE "Smart" TV to Get If You Want to Get Angry - a LOT!
reviewDescription: Never have I ever regretted the purchase of any appliance in my life as I immediately regretted this Vizio "Smart" TV!!! It turned itself on and off. That it would turn off in the middle of programs was bad enough, but when it turned itself on after midnight and in the early morning hours, then it had to be sent back! Even before that "Stupid" TV unpredictability, the remote could not be muted when surfing channels, and the muting would only last for 30 seconds at most when you purposefully chose to do it. No way to see what channel you were on, or what the channel numbers were when you were surfing them. Etc., etc., etc., AD NAUSEAM! And that's just a fraction of the many "user-unfriendly" features of this misbegotten junk! Now that I've bought an Insignia Smart TV that works well, I'm glad I did. And I wholeheartedly suggest that you do, too!

The tv itself is lightweight and has nice picture quality however that is the extent of the positives. Setting up the tv was a nightmare. It took ages for it to find the wifi network (keep in mind that it can only connect to a 2G network and not a 5G one). Once connected, there was an error code that persisted for a while and required me to do an extensive amount of troubleshooting. One of the most disappointing features is the lack of Bluetooth, so now I’ll need to order another piece to connect my headphones. All in all, I would NOT recommend purchasing this tv.

This is a nice TV, but it fails in many ways.  The most important is that it only comes with a very limited number of Apps available.  Hence most of my streaming apps, like Spectrum TV app or Hotwire TV are not loaded and can not be added.The second biggest issue, the shear lack of any information, like a manual.  Yes, there are directions for putting on the feet and signing up for your vizio account, but thats it.  The interface is very complicated and there is nothing to assist you.Third, when signing up for the Vizio app they ask permission to monitor and save all of your tv watching history.  REALLY!  The TV does not work if you decline, just shuts down.Called customer service and they blamed the app developers.  The developers probably just refused to pay a fee to be included on the TV.  This one is going back.

It came perfectly fine in the box with no damages. However when I opened it up and proceeded to do all the settings on it, the tv started to shut off on its own. When it finely stood on it wouldn’t let me download any tv apps

reviewTitle: Line on screen that won’t go away
reviewDescription: Have had this TV for less than a month and now there is this constant line going down the tv.. it does not go away. It is constant. The apps work but are slow to start. Spend a bit more and get something better

reviewTitle: No way to set it up!
reviewDescription: I turn it on, it tells me to push the menu button to start set up. THERES NO MENU BUTTON ON THE REMOTE AND NO BUTTONS ON THE TV EITHER!!!!!!! So how the frig am I supposed to connect to wifi? And try to talk to a human, good luck!
I bought this tv to use with an antenna.  When I turn it on, it looks for a wifi network. I gave to run setup to find the channels.  It SUCKS!  There is absolutely zero support from Amazon and Vizon.

reviewTitle: Great picture, everything else leaves much to be desired.
reviewDescription: - Picture quality: excellent- Sound: average to poor- Connectivity:  WIFI only (no wired ethernet)  -  connection is slow and fickle, requires frequent rebooting.- Apps: tons of useless junk apps.  the good ones you have to subscribe to and you don't get Spotify (only amazon music), no browser either.- Free Content: Lots of junk apps and channel. you better pay for streaming or cast shows from your smartphone- Performance: SLOW to start and requires frequent reboots (daily) as it gets stuck easily.  I have an 80 Mbps internet connection speed, which is fine for my other TV (Samsung) but barely enough for this Vizio.- Remote:  very cheaply built.  Often freezes- Casting: This is OK. it seems this TV was meant for Google casting, screen sharing or Apple AirplayOverall, this should be considered a CHEAP TV with everything that it implies...UPDATE after 6-month usage:TV still working but needs a cold reboot at least once a day.  I now see the dreaded "500 error", pretty much every day!
Takes forever to load and come on.Hard to navigate. I am tech savvy and experienced cord cutter and this is the worst tv I’ve ever had

This tv seemed ok at first, but after owning it for 2 months, I regret the purchase. It is slow, the picture is so-so, but that wouldn't bother me if it stayed on or was more user friendly.  I thought the price was nice, and plan to use it as a spare TV in my guest room. However my TV conked out so I have it my living room for now. It refuses to accept my passwords, so I'm only watching free TV with it. It shuts itself off randomly and you have to unplug it and plug it back in.Also the antenna TV part is very frustrating to use. It's so hard to change the channels or to even figure out the guide.

Believe the comment and do not buy. You might be like me and had a Vizio TV decade ago and this TV had the best picture quality and sound quality that was on the market but it's no longer a reality. VIZIO Is absolute "trash" now, the sound is terrible, it can't stay connected to the wifi for more than 20 minutes. You have to constantly reset it to factory setting. Don't buy, do yourself a favor and avoid all the troubles having to repackaged it and send it back .

reviewTitle: Broken straight out of the Box
reviewDescription: Cracked screen right out of the box I suggest buying your TV on the spot new in box by the time these tvs are shipped God only knows how many times it's dropped or tossed around so again my best advice is do what I did go buy one in person then check it out before you leave to make sure it's in New condition

reviewTitle: It's a tv but a slow one.
reviewDescription: I have the highest internet speed available. Watch free still buffers, all features are laggy  and slowly responding. Click an app it's gonna be awhile before it loads. Not seamless. At all graphics are okay color isn't all that great. Gaming mode works but that comes a with its own issues. Watch free basically requires you give all your data to vizio.

reviewTitle: Can't get Firestick into the HDMI ports, other ports too close
reviewDescription: I love vizio TV's but this one doesn't allow enough room around the two HDMI ports to get a Firestick in. It wouldn't be bad except I bought it as a gift to a person who needs to use the firestick to get a couple of apps that she watches all of the time. Unfortunately, I'll need to return it.

reviewTitle: Keeps making static noise and turning off
reviewDescription: I’m extremely disappointed in this purchase… Been needing a new tv for a bit now.. Finally took the leap and bought this one and have only had it 5.5 wks and and it keeps making a static noise and shuts off.. very frustrating and can’t return or replace through Amazon since I’m past 30 day return window.

I have only been able to use this TV about 5 times in 3 months because it is of such poor quality. The connectivity is extremely slow and movies constantly buffer. It will not connect to our 5G network or accept our Wi-Fi password. Very disappointed in how cheap it is.

reviewTitle: Do not buy - cheap for a reason
reviewDescription: This thing is awful. It’s cheap for a reason. The software sucks and always freezes up. The Atv forgets my WiFi name and password every time it’s turned on, requiring us to re-enter the details every time. I’d much rather spend a little more on a Samsung or Sony.

reviewTitle: Constant problems connecting to the internet.
reviewDescription: The TV is always loading, always failing to connect to wifi while streaming.  It is a huge headache and I would like a refund from Vizio. This tv is no good. The other Samsung TV in the same room is fine and has no problem connecting.

The tv is a perfect nightmare, is not compatible’s with any system and it doesn’t have any information about it. If you want to watch the cable channel you’ll spend easy an hour trying to set up the cable and the system asking you to restart the receiver 400 times until you just give up and leave the tv on for an hour and then pop!!!you can watch cable tv and after everything you went through all of the sudden you lost the cable connection, again no cable tv. Idk how I hold myself to not making the remote control part of the screen

Bought two Vizio TVs, both don’t load streaming applications. After 25 minutes of a support call, they told me there was nothing I could do to fix it. Wish I had done my research, seems like a lot of other people have had this issue.
Bought this Smart TV to use off of wifi. The very least I can do is hook up a DVD player with it! Will not connect to hotspots, wifi, nothing! Already burned the box so I can't return the POS

reviewTitle: Difficult tv if you don’t live in the USA or Canada
reviewDescription: RF cable/ coaxial cable placed under the the tv makes it difficult to screw the cable cord in especially being female with nails. Putting the input on tv/ antenna it wouldn’t work. You shouldn’t have to go through all kinds of settings and loading to watch live cable. I bought this for my mom and I wish I didn’t this tv is too difficult. We finally got it worked and her not being knowledgeable pressed something now I gotta figure it out again and not realizing what I did to get it on the first time because we was trying everything. Like I said not recommend. So frustrating I just hooked he old tv back up now it on the floor in the corner

The screws provided to attach the feet to the TV do not fit in the holes.  I used lighted magnifiers and after not having success, I tried just putting the screw in the hole without the foot and it does not fit.  It’s too late to return this piece of junk so we’ll have to jury rig something.  I am SO SICK of cheap junk.

This tv worked 1 week shy of 3 months. The return window was only 1 month. It should be longer for electronics. I had am electrician out and he determined the tv was my problem. The voltage of the tv knocked out all TVs in my house as well as my internet and we have done without our services for 2 days. And who helps me at Amazon? No one. The return window is closed. A tv one week shy of 3 months should not go bad and knock everything out in my house. Imagine my bill for an electrician who worked here for 5 hours only to find out the tv was the problem. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!!! TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY!!!!!!

reviewTitle: The worst tv I’ve ever bought
reviewDescription: I’ve never had a Vizio tv. First, it doesn’t offer Spotify, second it constantly drops connection, freezes, doesn’t work half the time. My onn roku tv never had these issues In the same room. Very disappointed

They basically force you to sign up for BOTH vizio and google access.  SO that they can track your useage and make sure that "you are getting the best service".  A rediculous invasion!!!  And I tried to opt out but you basically cannot use this TV unless you sign up to have both VIzio and Google track your useage.  After 3 times through the setup.....I give up.  Cant opt out so Im sending it back.  No more VIzios in my house!!!!

Honestly I’ve had this Tv for a month. It would never connect to the WIFI on its own. I’d have to forget network and type my password in every time I wanted to use it.Now the screen is going out of it. Haven’t moved it, haven’t touched it. Just turned it on, and the screen is going out.

reviewTitle: Lousy.... cheap looking product.  Horrible customerservivdd
reviewDescription: Cheep looking product, it doesn't work ...horrible, horrible customer service.  Tried contacting customer service sent two emails and they both bounced of course after I spent an hour trying to communicate with them.

reviewTitle: Lasted 90 days, Vizio failed to provide warranty, terrible service DO NOT BUY
reviewDescription: Support person not at all helpful, don't buy this product.  Terrible quality, broke in roughly 90 days.I will never buy another Vizio product with offshore warranty and support.Absolutely terrible.

Often when I try to turn on the TV, I get a blank screen.  I have to turn it off and on several times to get the home screen.  I tried using the Prime Video button to get somewhere; I got an error notice - first in German, then in Chinese or Japanese, then in English.  The message said there was an internet connectivity issue.  I am running another TV, a cell phone, and a laptop - no connectivity issues.The response from the remote is very slow.  When I try to lower the volume I press and hold, but nothing happens.  So I press it multiple times, nothing.  Suddenly the volume drops to zero because it finally got the hint, except I don't want zero.Don't buy this television.

The sound is tinny.It’s inconsistent and we have to turn it up very high.Everything else is ok.Easy to set up.We have only had it for a day.We will probably keep it.Customer service seems ok.I had a couple questions and they answered quickly.

Es un buen smart tv pero la compre para llevarla a rep. dom. Y resulta que fuera de usa o Canadá no tiene soporte para smartcast así que no se puede usar normalmente , si es para sacarla de eeuu mejor ni lo haga , lo peor es que en ningún lado habla de ello . Por eso le doy 3 estrella 😫

This afternoon I attempted to install this product, replacing my old TV mounted on the wall. After taking the old one down, it seems that the screws on the plate that attach to the TV, do not work in the new TV. This is ridiculous! The size of screws should be a standardized feature. Customers are inconvenienced by this type of proprietary engineering. Now, I need to find different screws or purchase a new mount system for the wall.

reviewTitle: Decent for the money, but somewhat grainy and buggy
reviewDescription: This was my first ever TV, and it gets the job done, but there's some notable areas where it could use improvement.pros: I love the built in chromecast, the sound is strong, and the picture is good enough.cons: After a few months of use, it sometimes freezes and doesn't respond to the remote. It also has limits on the apps you can install, meaning that I have to rely on the Chromecast to stream certain content, and the user interface is a mess - it's constantly advertising and autoplaying trailers for movies and TV shows that are on streaming platforms I don't have, but won't even let me add all of MY streaming services to the tiny ribbon of apps at the bottom of the home screen.I would probably get a Roku or something if I had it to do over again, but it's not so bad that I'm looking to get rid of it and buy something else. Still, it's worth spending a little extra money for something with a better picture, performance, and interface.

reviewTitle: Good price but ours were defective
reviewDescription: Size great but the sound goes in and out. Same show we have to adjust the sound every 10 minutes. First too loud, then too quiet, then too loud ect ect. If it was a once in a while defect we may let it slide but watching shows and movies are not enjoyable because we have to keep adjusting sound.

This TV was just a basic flat screen TV and I ended up returning it. And that meant weeks waiting for a refund! The crispness wasn't great and accessing common features such as bluetooth to airpods was either a pain or non-existent. It's pretty basic for the price. I upgraded to the next level and size up.

My only issue is the parental controls. I don't know how a password is ever supposed to be effective when the kids can see the numbers you type on the screen. It's a really terrible design flaw for parental controls.

reviewTitle: Great TV for a great price, but weird sound quality.
reviewDescription: Really great TV deal for the price. The quality is amazing and the remote work well, but the sound can get wonky and feel distorted to a point of degraded quality if the volume and bass are too loud.

reviewTitle: Is not compatible with direct tv
reviewDescription: I bought this because I wanted a smart tv so I wouldn't have to link a computer or firestick. But Vizio does not have access to ATT. So do not buy if you want to use direct tv
Have the new Vizio Tv only 6 months, then the remote controll just stopped working all together. Tried everything to get it going, nothing worked. Now I have to buy a new one

When I set up the TV the picture was great. But the sound was a little good until I went to set up and raise the bass and other once after that I went back to the volume and put it on 10 it sound real loud. I like it and it's Value for the money.

reviewTitle: Had to unplug a few times
reviewDescription: Well worth the money great buy less expensive than Walmart and Vizio is excellent. However it kept loading again and again and again and I kept unplugging it and it finally set and rebooted and worked (would say this will take about 10 minutes) and once set up did it all over again 2-3 times

I think we now have four Vizio's around the house. I love that I can screencast. I mounted this one to a wall on our outside, covered patio. I don't use it much, but when I run out of things to watch on streaming services, I got to the Watchfree option on our Vizios to find plenty more free content. They by far have the best bang for your buck.

reviewTitle: Good TV, but must have internet to set time
reviewDescription: We bought a "smart TV" to replace our old regular TV because the best deals are on smart TVs.  This TV looks and sounds good...  Unfortunately, Vizio did not make a way to set the time on this TV unless internet is connected.  Therefore, we are stuck with the wrong time which is ridiculous.

reviewTitle: Difficult to get TV to connect to WiFi
reviewDescription: I bought this TV looking something that would allow me to watch TV and play my switch, nothing fancy. The only issue I've had with this TV was getting it to work with the internet in my complex. Every day for about 3 weeks it would not connect to the internet automatically and I would have to connect it manually 3-4 times before it would connect to the network. After deciding whether to return or keep, it started working properly. Just be patient with it and it should work.

This is a good TV. I like the price for the size and the features that it has. The sound is good and so is the picture.  The only thing that I was disappointed by is that our cable app is not included on Vizio TVs. We've seen it drop from the Internet a few times, but I think that's more our Internet than the TV.
Love the quality
The TV is good but the processer is very slow !!!!

Has great picture quality. The price for a smart tv is fantastic. It isn’t super fancy. But so far quality is good. Be aware you don’t have Alexa voice option and I know philo app isn’t compatible yet. There might be others. Definitely recommend for the price though.

reviewTitle: Nice picture (coming from a 720p resolution 20 year old Sony).
reviewDescription: I bought this TV to replace a smaller 20 year old Sony.  It is used in the kitchen.Nice picture (coming from a 720p resolution 20 year old Sony).  Nice feature set in terms of being 'smart'.  I was able to modify an adjustable height monitor stand that I already had so I could mount the new set.  As you can see, my kitchen cabinets limited my overall height.  I was able to mount the new sound bar underneath the tv and made a nice compact package.  Make sure you buy a set with the inputs and outputs you need.  There are many choices and the more features there are, the higher the price.  This was fine for what I needed.
Good price point.  Decent pic and sounds ok. Fits on my cabinet in my bedroom.  Light weight and east set up.  I’m not picky but like it a lot especially for the price.
Ok
La calidad es buena y fácil de instalar
Lots of videos available
It’s a good tv

My bedroom tv which was old broke right before the holidays this year, and I did not want to spend alot on a tv for our room as it is not watched that often in that room.  Got this little Vizio smart tv on a Black Friday great deal.  It came the next day and works just perfect!  Great picture, smart features are very user friendly with quick speed.  Size is perfect for the bedroom.Love Vizio tvs anyway!  Definitely a good purchase and a great deal at the time!
Picture crisp and clear. Sound good.
The “feet” were difficult to put on and be stable.
TV arrived quickly and no issues with setup. One of the better smart TV deals that you’ll find on Amazon or anywhere. Both my TVs are Vizio and I’ve been generally happy with them.

I was searching for a TV for my bedroom, and after comparing price vs benefits, I ended up getting the Vizio TV, which is the same brand we have for the sound bar in the living room.I am very satisfied with the image quality and system sound of this model.I really recommend buying this TV.
